Package taskcoachlib :: Package thirdparty :: Module customtreectrl
[hide private]
[frames] | no frames]

Source Code for Module taskcoachlib.thirdparty.customtreectrl

   1  # --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- # 
   2  # CUSTOMTREECTRL wxPython IMPLEMENTATION 
   3  # Inspired By And Heavily Based On wxGenericTreeCtrl. 
   4  # 
   5  # Andrea Gavana, @ 17 May 2006 
   6  # Latest Revision: 08 Mar 2012, 21.00 GMT 
   7  # 
   8  # 
   9  # TODO List 
  10  # 
  11  # Almost All The Features Of wx.TreeCtrl Are Available, And There Is Practically 
  12  # No Limit In What Could Be Added To This Class. The First Things That Comes 
  13  # To My Mind Are: 
  14  # 
  15  # 1. Try To Implement A More Flicker-Free Background Image In Cases Like 
  16  #    Centered Or Stretched Image (Now CustomTreeCtrl Supports Only Tiled 
  17  #    Background Images). 
  18  # 
  19  # 2. Try To Mimic Windows wx.TreeCtrl Expanding/Collapsing behaviour: CustomTreeCtrl 
  20  #    Suddenly Expands/Collapses The Nodes On Mouse Click While The Native Control 
  21  #    Has Some Kind Of "Smooth" Expanding/Collapsing, Like A Wave. I Don't Even 
  22  #    Know Where To Start To Do That. 
  23  # 
  24  # 3. Speed Up General OnPaint Things? I Have No Idea, Here CustomTreeCtrl Is Quite 
  25  #    Fast, But We Should See On Slower Machines. 
  26  # 
  27  # 
  28  # For All Kind Of Problems, Requests Of Enhancements And Bug Reports, Please 
  29  # Write To Me At: 
  30  # 
  31  # andrea.gavana@maerskoil.com 
  32  # andrea.gavana@gmail.com 
  33  # 
  34  # Or, Obviously, To The wxPython Mailing List!!! 
  35  # 
  36  # 
  37  # End Of Comments 
  38  # --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- # 
  39   
  40   
  41  """ 
  42  L{CustomTreeCtrl} is a class that mimics the behaviour of `wx.TreeCtrl`, with some more 
  43  enhancements. 
  44   
  45   
  46  Description 
  47  =========== 
  48   
  49  L{CustomTreeCtrl} is a class that mimics the behaviour of `wx.TreeCtrl`, with almost the 
  50  same base functionalities plus some more enhancements. This class does not rely on 
  51  the native control, as it is a full owner-drawn tree control. 
  52  Apart of the base functionalities of L{CustomTreeCtrl} (described below), in addition 
  53  to the standard `wx.TreeCtrl` behaviour this class supports: 
  54   
  55  * CheckBox-type items: checkboxes are easy to handle, just selected or unselected 
  56    state with no particular issues in handling the item's children; 
  57  * Added support for 3-state value checkbox items; 
  58  * RadioButton-type items: since I elected to put radiobuttons in L{CustomTreeCtrl}, I 
  59    needed some way to handle them, that made sense. So, I used the following approach: 
  60     
  61    - All peer-nodes that are radiobuttons will be mutually exclusive. In other words, 
  62      only one of a set of radiobuttons that share a common parent can be checked at 
  63      once. If a radiobutton node becomes checked, then all of its peer radiobuttons 
  64      must be unchecked. 
  65    - If a radiobutton node becomes unchecked, then all of its child nodes will become 
  66      inactive. 
  67   
  68  * Hyperlink-type items: they look like an hyperlink, with the proper mouse cursor on 
  69    hovering; 
  70  * Multiline text items (**note**: to add a newline character in a multiline item, press 
  71    ``Shift`` + ``Enter`` as the ``Enter`` key alone is consumed by L{CustomTreeCtrl} to finish 
  72    the editing and ``Ctrl`` + ``Enter`` is consumed by the platform for tab navigation); 
  73  * Enabling/disabling items (together with their plain or grayed out icons); 
  74  * Whatever non-toplevel widget can be attached next to an item; 
  75  * Possibility to horizontally align the widgets attached to tree items on the 
  76    same tree level. 
  77  * Possibility to align the widgets attached to tree items to the rightmost edge of L{CustomTreeCtrl}; 
  78  * Default selection style, gradient (horizontal/vertical) selection style and Windows 
  79    Vista selection style; 
  80  * Customized drag and drop images built on the fly; 
  81  * Setting the L{CustomTreeCtrl} item buttons to a personalized imagelist; 
  82  * Setting the L{CustomTreeCtrl} check/radio item icons to a personalized imagelist; 
  83  * Changing the style of the lines that connect the items (in terms of `wx.Pen` styles); 
  84  * Using an image as a L{CustomTreeCtrl} background (currently only in "tile" mode); 
  85  * Adding images to any item in the leftmost area of the L{CustomTreeCtrl} client window. 
  86  * Separator-type items which are simply visual indicators that are meant to set apart 
  87    or divide tree items, with the following caveats: 
  88   
  89    - Separator items should not have children, labels, data or an associated window; 
  90    - You can change the color of individual separators by using L{SetItemTextColour}, or you can use 
  91      L{SetSeparatorColour} to change the color of all separators. The default separator colour 
  92      is that returned by `wx.SystemSettings.GetColour(wx.SYS_COLOUR_GRAYTEXT)`; 
  93    - Separators can be selected just like any other tree item; 
  94    - Separators cannot have text; 
  95    - Separators cannot have children; 
  96    - Separators cannot be edited via the ``EVT_TREE_BEGIN_LABEL_EDIT`` event. 
  97   
  98  * Ellipsization of long items when the horizontal space is low, via the ``TR_ELLIPSIZE_LONG_ITEMS`` 
  99    style (`New in version 0.9.3`); 
 100  * Tooltips on long items when the horizontal space is low, via the ``TR_TOOLTIP_ON_LONG_ITEMS`` 
 101    style (`New in version 0.9.3`). 
 102   
 103  And a lot more. Check the demo for an almost complete review of the functionalities. 
 104   
 105   
 106  Base Functionalities 
 107  ==================== 
 108   
 109  L{CustomTreeCtrl} supports all the `wx.TreeCtrl` styles, except: 
 110   
 111  - ``TR_EXTENDED``: supports for this style is on the todo list (am I sure of this?). 
 112   
 113  Plus it has 3 more styles to handle checkbox-type items: 
 114   
 115  - ``TR_AUTO_CHECK_CHILD``: automatically checks/unchecks the item children; 
 116  - ``TR_AUTO_CHECK_PARENT``: automatically checks/unchecks the item parent; 
 117  - ``TR_AUTO_TOGGLE_CHILD``: automatically toggles the item children. 
 118   
 119  And two styles you can use to force the horizontal alignment of all the widgets 
 120  attached to the tree items: 
 121   
 122  - ``TR_ALIGN_WINDOWS``: aligns horizontally the windows belonging to the item on the 
 123    same tree level. 
 124  - ``TR_ALIGN_WINDOWS_RIGHT``: aligns to the rightmost position the windows belonging 
 125    to the item on the same tree level. 
 126   
 127  And two styles related to long items (with a lot of text in them), which can be  
 128  ellipsized and/or highlighted with a tooltip: 
 129   
 130  - ``TR_ELLIPSIZE_LONG_ITEMS``: ellipsizes long items when the horizontal space for 
 131    L{CustomTreeCtrl} is low (`New in version 0.9.3`); 
 132  - ``TR_TOOLTIP_ON_LONG_ITEMS``: shows tooltips on long items when the horizontal space 
 133    for L{CustomTreeCtrl} is low (`New in version 0.9.3`);. 
 134   
 135  All the methods available in `wx.TreeCtrl` are also available in L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
 136   
 137   
 138  Usage 
 139  ===== 
 140   
 141  Usage example:: 
 142   
 143      import wx 
 144      import wx.lib.agw.customtreectrl as CT 
 145   
 146      class MyFrame(wx.Frame): 
 147   
 148          def __init__(self, parent): 
 149   
 150              wx.Frame.__init(self, parent, -1, "CustomTreeCtrl Demo")         
 151   
 152              # Create a CustomTreeCtrl instance 
 153              custom_tree = CT.CustomTreeCtrl(self, agwStyle=wx.TR_DEFAULT_STYLE) 
 154               
 155              # Add a root node to it 
 156              root = custom_tree.AddRoot("The Root Item")             
 157   
 158              # Create an image list to add icons next to an item 
 159              il = wx.ImageList(16, 16) 
 160              fldridx     = il.Add(wx.ArtProvider_GetBitmap(wx.ART_FOLDER,      wx.ART_OTHER, 16)) 
 161              fldropenidx = il.Add(wx.ArtProvider_GetBitmap(wx.ART_FILE_OPEN,   wx.ART_OTHER, 16)) 
 162              fileidx     = il.Add(wx.ArtProvider_GetBitmap(wx.ART_NORMAL_FILE, wx.ART_OTHER, 16)) 
 163   
 164              custom_tree.SetImageList(il) 
 165               
 166              custom_tree.SetItemImage(root, fldridx, wx.TreeItemIcon_Normal) 
 167              custom_tree.SetItemImage(root, fldropenidx, wx.TreeItemIcon_Expanded) 
 168   
 169              for x in range(15): 
 170                  child = custom_tree.AppendItem(root, "Item %d" % x) 
 171                  custom_tree.SetItemImage(child, fldridx, wx.TreeItemIcon_Normal) 
 172                  custom_tree.SetItemImage(child, fldropenidx, wx.TreeItemIcon_Expanded) 
 173   
 174                  for y in range(5): 
 175                      last = custom_tree.AppendItem(child, "item %d-%s" % (x, chr(ord("a")+y))) 
 176                      custom_tree.SetItemImage(last, fldridx, wx.TreeItemIcon_Normal) 
 177                      custom_tree.SetItemImage(last, fldropenidx, wx.TreeItemIcon_Expanded) 
 178   
 179                      for z in range(5): 
 180                          item = custom_tree.AppendItem(last,  "item %d-%s-%d" % (x, chr(ord("a")+y), z)) 
 181                          custom_tree.SetItemImage(item, fileidx, wx.TreeItemIcon_Normal) 
 182                          custom_tree.SetItemImage(item, smileidx, wx.TreeItemIcon_Selected) 
 183   
 184              custom_tree.Expand(self.root) 
 185   
 186   
 187      # our normal wxApp-derived class, as usual 
 188   
 189      app = wx.PySimpleApp() 
 190   
 191      frame = MyFrame(None) 
 192      app.SetTopWindow(frame) 
 193      frame.Show() 
 194   
 195      app.MainLoop() 
 196   
 197   
 198           
 199  Events 
 200  ====== 
 201   
 202  All the events supported by `wx.TreeCtrl` are also available in L{CustomTreeCtrl}, with 
 203  a few exceptions: 
 204   
 205  - ``EVT_TREE_GET_INFO`` (don't know what this means); 
 206  - ``EVT_TREE_SET_INFO`` (don't know what this means); 
 207  - ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_MIDDLE_CLICK`` (not implemented, but easy to add); 
 208  - ``EVT_TREE_STATE_IMAGE_CLICK`` (no need for that, look at the checking events below). 
 209   
 210  Plus, L{CustomTreeCtrl} supports the events related to the checkbutton-type items: 
 211   
 212  - ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKING``: an item is being checked; 
 213  - ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKED``: an item has been checked. 
 214   
 215  And to hyperlink-type items: 
 216   
 217  - ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_HYPERLINK``: an hyperlink item has been clicked (this event is sent 
 218    after the ``EVT_TREE_SEL_CHANGED`` event). 
 219   
 220   
 221  Supported Platforms 
 222  =================== 
 223   
 224  L{CustomTreeCtrl} has been tested on the following platforms: 
 225    * Windows (Windows XP); 
 226    * GTK (Thanks to Michele Petrazzo); 
 227    * Mac OS (Thanks to John Jackson). 
 228   
 229   
 230  Window Styles 
 231  ============= 
 232   
 233  This class supports the following window styles: 
 234   
 235  ============================== =========== ================================================== 
 236  Window Styles                  Hex Value   Description 
 237  ============================== =========== ================================================== 
 238  ``TR_NO_BUTTONS``                      0x0 For convenience to document that no buttons are to be drawn. 
 239  ``TR_SINGLE``                          0x0 For convenience to document that only one item may be selected at a time. Selecting another item causes the current selection, if any, to be deselected. This is the default. 
 240  ``TR_HAS_BUTTONS``                     0x1 Use this style to show + and - buttons to the left of parent items. 
 241  ``TR_NO_LINES``                        0x4 Use this style to hide vertical level connectors. 
 242  ``TR_LINES_AT_ROOT``                   0x8 Use this style to show lines between root nodes. Only applicable if ``TR_HIDE_ROOT`` is set and ``TR_NO_LINES`` is not set. 
 243  ``TR_DEFAULT_STYLE``                   0x9 The set of flags that are closest to the defaults for the native control for a particular toolkit. 
 244  ``TR_TWIST_BUTTONS``                  0x10 Use old Mac-twist style buttons. 
 245  ``TR_MULTIPLE``                       0x20 Use this style to allow a range of items to be selected. If a second range is selected, the current range, if any, is deselected. 
 246  ``TR_EXTENDED``                       0x40 Use this style to allow disjoint items to be selected. (Only partially implemented; may not work in all cases). 
 247  ``TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT``        0x80 Use this style to cause row heights to be just big enough to fit the content. If not set, all rows use the largest row height. The default is that this flag is unset. 
 248  ``TR_EDIT_LABELS``                   0x200 Use this style if you wish the user to be able to edit labels in the tree control. 
 249  ``TR_ROW_LINES``                     0x400 Use this style to draw a contrasting border between displayed rows. 
 250  ``TR_HIDE_ROOT``                     0x800 Use this style to suppress the display of the root node, effectively causing the first-level nodes to appear as a series of root nodes. 
 251  ``TR_FULL_ROW_HIGHLIGHT``           0x2000 Use this style to have the background colour and the selection highlight extend  over the entire horizontal row of the tree control window. 
 252  ``TR_AUTO_CHECK_CHILD``             0x4000 Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a parent item is checked/unchecked its children are checked/unchecked as well. 
 253  ``TR_AUTO_TOGGLE_CHILD``            0x8000 Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a parent item is checked/unchecked its children are toggled accordingly. 
 254  ``TR_AUTO_CHECK_PARENT``           0x10000 Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a child item is checked/unchecked its parent item is checked/unchecked as well. 
 255  ``TR_ALIGN_WINDOWS``               0x20000 Flag used to align windows (in items with windows) at the same horizontal position. 
 256  ``TR_ALIGN_WINDOWS_RIGHT``         0x40000 Flag used to align windows (in items with windows) to the rightmost edge of L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
 257  ``TR_ELLIPSIZE_LONG_ITEMS``        0x80000 Flag used to ellipsize long items when the horizontal space for L{CustomTreeCtrl} is low. 
 258  ``TR_TOOLTIP_ON_LONG_ITEMS``      0x100000 Flag used to show tooltips on long items when the horizontal space for L{CustomTreeCtrl} is low. 
 259  ============================== =========== ================================================== 
 260   
 261   
 262  Events Processing 
 263  ================= 
 264   
 265  This class processes the following events: 
 266   
 267  ============================== ================================================== 
 268  Event Name                     Description 
 269  ============================== ================================================== 
 270  ``EVT_TREE_BEGIN_DRAG``        Begin dragging with the left mouse button. 
 271  ``EVT_TREE_BEGIN_LABEL_EDIT``  Begin editing a label. This can be prevented by calling L{Veto}. 
 272  ``EVT_TREE_BEGIN_RDRAG``       Begin dragging with the right mouse button. 
 273  ``EVT_TREE_DELETE_ITEM``       Delete an item. 
 274  ``EVT_TREE_END_DRAG``          End dragging with the left or right mouse button. 
 275  ``EVT_TREE_END_LABEL_EDIT``    End editing a label. This can be prevented by calling L{Veto}. 
 276  ``EVT_TREE_GET_INFO``          Request information from the application (not implemented in L{CustomTreeCtrl}). 
 277  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_ACTIVATED``    The item has been activated, i.e. chosen by double clicking it with mouse or from keyboard. 
 278  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKED``      A checkbox or radiobox type item has been checked. 
 279  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKING``     A checkbox or radiobox type item is being checked. 
 280  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_COLLAPSED``    The item has been collapsed. 
 281  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_COLLAPSING``   The item is being collapsed. This can be prevented by calling L{Veto}. 
 282  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDED``     The item has been expanded. 
 283  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDING``    The item is being expanded. This can be prevented by calling L{Veto}. 
 284  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_GETTOOLTIP``   The opportunity to set the item tooltip is being given to the application (call `TreeEvent.SetToolTip`). 
 285  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_HYPERLINK``    An hyperlink type item has been clicked. 
 286  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_MENU``         The context menu for the selected item has been requested, either by a right click or by using the menu key. 
 287  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_MIDDLE_CLICK`` The user has clicked the item with the middle mouse button (not implemented in L{CustomTreeCtrl}). 
 288  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_RIGHT_CLICK``  The user has clicked the item with the right mouse button. 
 289  ``EVT_TREE_KEY_DOWN``          A key has been pressed. 
 290  ``EVT_TREE_SEL_CHANGED``       Selection has changed. 
 291  ``EVT_TREE_SEL_CHANGING``      Selection is changing. This can be prevented by calling L{Veto}. 
 292  ``EVT_TREE_SET_INFO``          Information is being supplied to the application (not implemented in L{CustomTreeCtrl}). 
 293  ``EVT_TREE_STATE_IMAGE_CLICK`` The state image has been clicked (not implemented in L{CustomTreeCtrl}). 
 294  ============================== ================================================== 
 295   
 296

 298  =================== 
 299

 304  Version 2.6 
 305   
 306  """ 
 307   
 308  # Version Info 
 309  __version__ = "2.6" 
 310   
 311  import wx 
 312  from wx.lib.expando import ExpandoTextCtrl 
 313   
 314  # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 315  # Constants 
 316  # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 317   
 318  _NO_IMAGE = -1 
 319  _PIXELS_PER_UNIT = 10 
 320   
 321  # Start editing the current item after half a second (if the mouse hasn't 
 322  # been clicked/moved) 
 323  _DELAY = 500 
 324   
 325  # wxPython version string 
 326  _VERSION_STRING = wx.VERSION_STRING 
 327   
 328  # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 329  # Constants 
 330  # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 331   
 332  # Enum for different images associated with a treectrl item 
 333  TreeItemIcon_Normal = 0              # not selected, not expanded 
 334  """ The tree item is not selected and not expanded. """ 
 335  TreeItemIcon_Selected = 1            #     selected, not expanded 
 336  """ The tree item is selected and not expanded. """ 
 337  TreeItemIcon_Expanded = 2            # not selected,     expanded 
 338  """ The tree item is not selected but expanded. """ 
 339  TreeItemIcon_SelectedExpanded = 3    #     selected,     expanded 
 340  """ The tree item is selected and expanded. """ 
 341  TreeItemIcon_Checked = 0             # check button,     checked 
 342  """ The item's check button is checked. """ 
 343  TreeItemIcon_NotChecked = 1          # check button, not checked 
 344  """ The item's check button is not checked. """ 
 345  TreeItemIcon_Undetermined = 2        # check button, undetermined 
 346  """ The item's check button is in undetermined state (used only for a 3-state check button). """ 
 347  TreeItemIcon_Flagged = 3             # radio button,     selected 
 348  """ The item's radio button is checked. """ 
 349  TreeItemIcon_NotFlagged = 4          # radio button, not selected 
 350  """ The item's radio button is not checked. """ 
 351   
 352  # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 353  # CustomTreeCtrl flags 
 354  # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 355   
 356  TR_NO_BUTTONS = wx.TR_NO_BUTTONS                               # for convenience 
 357  """ For convenience to document that no buttons are to be drawn. """ 
 358  TR_HAS_BUTTONS = wx.TR_HAS_BUTTONS                             # draw collapsed/expanded btns 
 359  """ Use this style to show + and - buttons to the left of parent items. """ 
 360  TR_NO_LINES = wx.TR_NO_LINES                                   # don't draw lines at all 
 361  """ Use this style to hide vertical level connectors. """ 
 362  TR_LINES_AT_ROOT = wx.TR_LINES_AT_ROOT                         # connect top-level nodes 
 363  """ Use this style to show lines between root nodes. Only applicable if ``TR_HIDE_ROOT`` is""" \ 
 364  """ set and ``TR_NO_LINES`` is not set. """ 
 365  TR_TWIST_BUTTONS = wx.TR_TWIST_BUTTONS                         # still used by wxTreeListCtrl 
 366  """ Use old Mac-twist style buttons. """ 
 367  TR_SINGLE = wx.TR_SINGLE                                       # for convenience 
 368  """ For convenience to document that only one item may be selected at a time. Selecting another""" \ 
 369  """ item causes the current selection, if any, to be deselected. This is the default. """ 
 370  TR_MULTIPLE = wx.TR_MULTIPLE                                   # can select multiple items 
 371  """ Use this style to allow a range of items to be selected. If a second range is selected,""" \ 
 372  """ the current range, if any, is deselected. """ 
 373  TR_EXTENDED = wx.TR_EXTENDED                                   # TODO: allow extended selection 
 374  """ Use this style to allow disjoint items to be selected. (Only partially implemented;""" \ 
 375  """ may not work in all cases). """ 
 376  TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT = wx.TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT     # what it says 
 377  """ Use this style to cause row heights to be just big enough to fit the content.""" \ 
 378  """ If not set, all rows use the largest row height. The default is that this flag is unset. """ 
 379  TR_EDIT_LABELS = wx.TR_EDIT_LABELS                             # can edit item labels 
 380  """ Use this style if you wish the user to be able to edit labels in the tree control. """ 
 381  TR_ROW_LINES = wx.TR_ROW_LINES                                 # put border around items 
 382  """ Use this style to draw a contrasting border between displayed rows. """ 
 383  TR_HIDE_ROOT = wx.TR_HIDE_ROOT                                 # don't display root node 
 384  """ Use this style to suppress the display of the root node, effectively causing the""" \ 
 385  """ first-level nodes to appear as a series of root nodes. """ 
 386  TR_FULL_ROW_HIGHLIGHT = wx.TR_FULL_ROW_HIGHLIGHT               # highlight full horz space 
 387  """ Use this style to have the background colour and the selection highlight extend """ \ 
 388  """ over the entire horizontal row of the tree control window. """ 
 389   
 390  TR_AUTO_CHECK_CHILD = 0x04000                                  # only meaningful for checkboxes 
 391  """ Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a parent item is checked/unchecked""" \ 
 392  """ its children are checked/unchecked as well. """ 
 393  TR_AUTO_TOGGLE_CHILD = 0x08000                                 # only meaningful for checkboxes 
 394  """ Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a parent item is checked/unchecked""" \ 
 395  """ its children are toggled accordingly. """ 
 396  TR_AUTO_CHECK_PARENT = 0x10000                                 # only meaningful for checkboxes 
 397  """ Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a child item is checked/unchecked""" \ 
 398  """ its parent item is checked/unchecked as well. """ 
 399  TR_ALIGN_WINDOWS = 0x20000                                     # to align windows horizontally for items at the same level 
 400  """ Flag used to align windows (in items with windows) at the same horizontal position. """ 
 401  TR_ALIGN_WINDOWS_RIGHT = 0x40000                               # to align windows to the rightmost edge of CustomTreeCtrl 
 402  """ Flag used to align windows (in items with windows) to the rightmost edge of L{CustomTreeCtrl}.""" 
 403  TR_ELLIPSIZE_LONG_ITEMS = 0x80000                              # to ellipsize long items when horizontal space is low 
 404  """ Flag used to ellipsize long items when the horizontal space for L{CustomTreeCtrl} is low.""" 
 405  TR_TOOLTIP_ON_LONG_ITEMS = 0x100000                            # to display tooltips on long items when horizontal space is low 
 406  """ Flag used to show tooltips on long items when the horizontal space for L{CustomTreeCtrl} is low.""" 
 407   
 408  TR_DEFAULT_STYLE = wx.TR_DEFAULT_STYLE                         # default style for the tree control 
 409  """ The set of flags that are closest to the defaults for the native control for a""" \ 
 410  """ particular toolkit. """ 
 411   
 412  # Values for the `flags` parameter of CustomTreeCtrl.HitTest() which determine 
 413  # where exactly the specified point is situated: 
 414   
 415  TREE_HITTEST_ABOVE            = wx.TREE_HITTEST_ABOVE 
 416  TREE_HITTEST_BELOW            = wx.TREE_HITTEST_BELOW 
 417  TREE_HITTEST_NOWHERE          = wx.TREE_HITTEST_NOWHERE 
 418  # on the button associated with an item. 
 419  TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMBUTTON     = wx.TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMBUTTON 
 420  # on the bitmap associated with an item. 
 421  TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMICON       = wx.TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMICON 
 422  # on the indent associated with an item. 
 423  TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMINDENT     = wx.TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMINDENT 
 424  # on the label (string) associated with an item. 
 425  TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMLABEL      = wx.TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMLABEL 
 426  # on the right of the label associated with an item. 
 427  TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMRIGHT      = wx.TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMRIGHT 
 428  # on the label (string) associated with an item. 
 429  TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMSTATEICON  = wx.TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMSTATEICON 
 430  # on the left of the CustomTreeCtrl. 
 431  TREE_HITTEST_TOLEFT           = wx.TREE_HITTEST_TOLEFT 
 432  # on the right of the CustomTreeCtrl. 
 433  TREE_HITTEST_TORIGHT          = wx.TREE_HITTEST_TORIGHT 
 434  # on the upper part (first half) of the item. 
 435  TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMUPPERPART  = wx.TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMUPPERPART 
 436  # on the lower part (second half) of the item. 
 437  TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMLOWERPART  = wx.TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMLOWERPART 
 438  # on the check icon, if present 
 439  TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMCHECKICON  = 0x4000 
 440  # anywhere on the item 
 441  TREE_HITTEST_ONITEM  = TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMICON | TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMLABEL | TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMCHECKICON 
 442   
 443  TREE_ITEMTYPE_NORMAL = 0 
 444  TREE_ITEMTYPE_CHECK = 1 
 445  TREE_ITEMTYPE_RADIO = 2 
 446   
 447  # Background Image Style 
 448  _StyleTile = 0 
 449  _StyleStretch = 1 
 450   
 451  # Windows Vista Colours 
 452  _rgbSelectOuter = wx.Colour(170, 200, 245) 
 453  _rgbSelectInner = wx.Colour(230, 250, 250) 
 454  _rgbSelectTop = wx.Colour(210, 240, 250) 
 455  _rgbSelectBottom = wx.Colour(185, 215, 250) 
 456  _rgbNoFocusTop = wx.Colour(250, 250, 250) 
 457  _rgbNoFocusBottom = wx.Colour(235, 235, 235) 
 458  _rgbNoFocusOuter = wx.Colour(220, 220, 220) 
 459  _rgbNoFocusInner = wx.Colour(245, 245, 245) 
 460   
 461  # Flags for wx.RendererNative 
 462  _CONTROL_EXPANDED = 8 
 463  _CONTROL_CURRENT = 16 
 464               
 465   
 466  # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 547 -def MakeDisabledBitmap(original): 

 548      """ 
 549      Creates a disabled-looking bitmap starting from the input one. 
 550   
 551      :param `original`: an instance of `wx.Bitmap` to be greyed-out. 
 552   
 553      :return: An instance of `wx.Bitmap`, containing a disabled-looking 
 554       representation of the original item image. 
 555      """ 
 556       
 557      img = original.ConvertToImage() 
 558      return wx.BitmapFromImage(img.ConvertToGreyscale())

 562 -def DrawTreeItemButton(win, dc, rect, flags): 

 563      """ 
 564      Draw the expanded/collapsed icon for a tree control item. 
 565   
 566      :param `win`: an instance of `wx.Window`; 
 567      :param `dc`: an instance of `wx.DC`; 
 568      :param `wx.Rect` `rect`: the client rectangle where to draw the tree item button; 
 569      :param integer `flags`: contains ``wx.CONTROL_EXPANDED`` bit for expanded tree items. 
 570   
 571      :note: This is a simple replacement of `wx.RendererNative.DrawTreeItemButton`. 
 572   
 573      :note: This method is never used in wxPython versions newer than 2.6.2.1.     
 574      """ 
 575   
 576      # white background 
 577      dc.SetPen(wx.GREY_PEN) 
 578      dc.SetBrush(wx.WHITE_BRUSH) 
 579      dc.DrawRectangleRect(rect) 
 580   
 581      # black lines 
 582      xMiddle = rect.x + rect.width/2 
 583      yMiddle = rect.y + rect.height/2 
 584   
 585      # half of the length of the horz lines in "-" and "+" 
 586      halfWidth = rect.width/2 - 2 
 587      dc.SetPen(wx.BLACK_PEN) 
 588      dc.DrawLine(xMiddle - halfWidth, yMiddle, 
 589                  xMiddle + halfWidth + 1, yMiddle) 
 590   
 591      if not flags & _CONTROL_EXPANDED: 
 592       
 593          # turn "-" into "+" 
 594          halfHeight = rect.height/2 - 2 
 595          dc.DrawLine(xMiddle, yMiddle - halfHeight, 
 596                      xMiddle, yMiddle + halfHeight + 1) 

 597   
 598  # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 599   

 600 -def EventFlagsToSelType(style, shiftDown=False, ctrlDown=False): 

 601      """ 
 602      Translate the key or mouse event flag to the type of selection we 
 603      are dealing with. 
 604   
 605      :param integer `style`: the main L{CustomTreeCtrl} window style flag; 
 606      :param bool `shiftDown`: ``True`` if the ``Shift`` key is pressed, ``False`` otherwise; 
 607      :param bool `ctrlDown`: ``True`` if the ``Ctrl`` key is pressed, ``False`` otherwise; 
 608   
 609      :return: A 3-elements tuple, with the following elements: 
 610       
 611       - `is_multiple`: ``True`` if L{CustomTreeCtrl} has the ``TR_MULTIPLE`` flag set, ``False`` otherwise; 
 612       - `extended_select`: ``True`` if the ``Shift`` key is pressend and if L{CustomTreeCtrl} has the 
 613         ``TR_MULTIPLE`` flag set, ``False`` otherwise; 
 614       - `unselect_others`: ``True`` if the ``Ctrl`` key is pressend and if L{CustomTreeCtrl} has the 
 615         ``TR_MULTIPLE`` flag set, ``False`` otherwise. 
 616      """ 
 617   
 618      is_multiple = (style & TR_MULTIPLE) != 0 
 619      extended_select = shiftDown and is_multiple 
 620      unselect_others = not (extended_select or (ctrlDown and is_multiple)) 
 621   
 622      return is_multiple, extended_select, unselect_others 

 623   
 624  # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 625   

 626 -def ChopText(dc, text, max_size): 

 627      """ 
 628      Chops the input `text` if its size does not fit in `max_size`, by cutting the 
 629      text and adding ellipsis at the end. 
 630   
 631      :param `dc`: a `wx.DC` device context; 
 632      :param `text`: the text to chop; 
 633      :param `max_size`: the maximum size in which the text should fit. 
 634   
 635      :note: This method is used exclusively when L{CustomTreeCtrl} has the ``TR_ELLIPSIZE_LONG_ITEMS`` 
 636       style set. 
 637   
 638      .. versionadded:: 0.9.3 
 639      """ 
 640       
 641      # first check if the text fits with no problems 
 642      x, y, dummy = dc.GetMultiLineTextExtent(text) 
 643       
 644      if x <= max_size: 
 645          return text 
 646   
 647      textLen = len(text) 
 648      last_good_length = 0 
 649       
 650      for i in xrange(textLen, -1, -1): 
 651          s = text[0:i] 
 652          s += "..." 
 653   
 654          x, y = dc.GetTextExtent(s) 
 655          last_good_length = i 
 656           
 657          if x < max_size: 
 658              break 
 659   
 660      ret = text[0:last_good_length] + "..."     
 661      return ret 

 662   
 663       
 664  #--------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 665  # DragImage Implementation 
 666  # This Class Handles The Creation Of A Custom Image In Case Of Item Drag 
 667  # And Drop. 
 668  #--------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 669   

 670 -class DragImage(wx.DragImage): 

 671      """ 
 672      This class handles the creation of a custom image in case of item drag 
 673      and drop. 
 674      """ 
 675   

 676 -    def __init__(self, treeCtrl, item): 

 677          """ 
 678          Default class constructor. 
 679          For internal use: do not call it in your code! 
 680   
 681          :param `treeCtrl`: the parent L{CustomTreeCtrl}; 
 682          :param `item`: one of the tree control item (an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}). 
 683          """ 
 684           
 685          text = item.GetText() 
 686          font = item.Attr().GetFont() 
 687          colour = item.Attr().GetTextColour() 
 688          if not colour: 
 689              colour = wx.BLACK 
 690          if not font: 
 691              font = treeCtrl._normalFont 
 692       
 693          backcolour = treeCtrl.GetBackgroundColour() 
 694          r, g, b = int(backcolour.Red()), int(backcolour.Green()), int(backcolour.Blue()) 
 695          backcolour = ((r >> 1) + 20, (g >> 1) + 20, (b >> 1) + 20) 
 696          backcolour = wx.Colour(backcolour[0], backcolour[1], backcolour[2]) 
 697          self._backgroundColour = backcolour 
 698   
 699          tempdc = wx.ClientDC(treeCtrl) 
 700          tempdc.SetFont(font) 
 701          width, height, dummy = tempdc.GetMultiLineTextExtent(text + "M") 
 702           
 703          image = item.GetCurrentImage() 
 704   
 705          image_w, image_h = 0, 0 
 706          wcheck, hcheck = 0, 0 
 707          itemcheck = None 
 708          itemimage = None 
 709          ximagepos = 0 
 710          yimagepos = 0 
 711          xcheckpos = 0 
 712          ycheckpos = 0 
 713           
 714          if image != _NO_IMAGE:     
 715              if treeCtrl._imageListNormal: 
 716                  image_w, image_h = treeCtrl._imageListNormal.GetSize(image) 
 717                  image_w += 4 
 718                  itemimage = treeCtrl._imageListNormal.GetBitmap(image) 
 719               
 720          checkimage = item.GetCurrentCheckedImage() 
 721   
 722          if checkimage is not None: 
 723              if treeCtrl._imageListCheck: 
 724                  wcheck, hcheck = treeCtrl._imageListCheck.GetSize(checkimage) 
 725                  wcheck += 4 
 726                  itemcheck = treeCtrl._imageListCheck.GetBitmap(checkimage) 
 727   
 728          total_h = max(hcheck, height) 
 729          total_h = max(image_h, total_h) 
 730                   
 731          if image_w: 
 732              ximagepos = wcheck 
 733              yimagepos = ((total_h > image_h) and [(total_h-image_h)/2] or [0])[0] 
 734   
 735          if checkimage is not None: 
 736              xcheckpos = 2 
 737              ycheckpos = ((total_h > image_h) and [(total_h-image_h)/2] or [0])[0] + 2 
 738   
 739          extraH = ((total_h > height) and [(total_h - height)/2] or [0])[0] 
 740           
 741          xtextpos = wcheck + image_w 
 742          ytextpos = extraH 
 743   
 744          total_h = max(image_h, hcheck) 
 745          total_h = max(total_h, height) 
 746           
 747          if total_h < 30: 
 748              total_h += 2            # at least 2 pixels 
 749          else: 
 750              total_h += total_h/10   # otherwise 10% extra spacing 
 751   
 752          total_w = image_w + wcheck + width 
 753   
 754          self._total_w = total_w 
 755          self._total_h = total_h 
 756          self._itemimage = itemimage 
 757          self._itemcheck = itemcheck 
 758          self._text = text 
 759          self._colour = colour 
 760          self._font = font 
 761          self._xtextpos = xtextpos 
 762          self._ytextpos = ytextpos 
 763          self._ximagepos = ximagepos 
 764          self._yimagepos = yimagepos 
 765          self._xcheckpos = xcheckpos 
 766          self._ycheckpos = ycheckpos 
 767          self._textwidth = width 
 768          self._textheight = height 
 769          self._extraH = extraH 
 770           
 771          self._bitmap = self.CreateBitmap() 
 772   
 773          wx.DragImage.__init__(self, self._bitmap) 

 774   
 775   

 776 -    def CreateBitmap(self): 

 777          """ 
 778          Actually creates the drag and drop bitmap for L{DragImage}. 
 779   
 780          :return: An instance of L{DragImage}, a close representation of the item's 
 781           appearance (i.e., a screenshot of the item). 
 782          """ 
 783   
 784          memory = wx.MemoryDC() 
 785   
 786          bitmap = wx.EmptyBitmap(self._total_w, self._total_h) 
 787          memory.SelectObject(bitmap) 
 788   
 789          if wx.Platform == '__WXMAC__': 
 790              memory.SetBackground(wx.TRANSPARENT_BRUSH) 
 791          else: 
 792              memory.SetBackground(wx.Brush(self._backgroundColour)) 
 793          memory.SetBackgroundMode(wx.TRANSPARENT) 
 794          memory.SetFont(self._font) 
 795          memory.SetTextForeground(self._colour) 
 796          memory.Clear() 
 797   
 798          if self._itemimage: 
 799              memory.DrawBitmap(self._itemimage, self._ximagepos, self._yimagepos, True) 
 800   
 801          if self._itemcheck: 
 802              memory.DrawBitmap(self._itemcheck, self._xcheckpos, self._ycheckpos, True) 
 803   
 804          textrect = wx.Rect(self._xtextpos, self._ytextpos+self._extraH, self._textwidth, self._textheight) 
 805          memory.DrawLabel(self._text, textrect) 
 806   
 807          memory.SelectObject(wx.NullBitmap) 
 808           
 809          # Gtk and Windows unfortunatly don't do so well with transparent 
 810          # drawing so this hack corrects the image to have a transparent 
 811          # background. 
 812          if wx.Platform != '__WXMAC__': 
 813              timg = bitmap.ConvertToImage() 
 814              if not timg.HasAlpha(): 
 815                  timg.InitAlpha() 
 816              for y in xrange(timg.GetHeight()): 
 817                  for x in xrange(timg.GetWidth()): 
 818                      pix = wx.Colour(timg.GetRed(x, y), 
 819                                      timg.GetGreen(x, y), 
 820                                      timg.GetBlue(x, y)) 
 821                      if pix == self._backgroundColour: 
 822                          timg.SetAlpha(x, y, 0) 
 823              bitmap = timg.ConvertToBitmap() 
 824          return bitmap         

 825   
 826

 952 -class CommandTreeEvent(wx.PyCommandEvent): 

 953      """ 
 954      L{CommandTreeEvent} is a special subclassing of `wx.PyCommandEvent`. 
 955   
 956      :note: Not all the accessors make sense for all the events, see the event description for every method in this class.  
 957      """ 
 958       

 959 -    def __init__(self, evtType, evtId, item=None, evtKey=None, point=None,

 961          """ 
 962          Default class constructor. 
 963          For internal use: do not call it in your code! 
 964   
 965          :param integer `evtType`: the event type; 
 966          :param integer `evtId`: the event identifier; 
 967          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
 968          :param integer `evtKey`: a character ordinal; 
 969          :param `point`: an instance of `wx.Point`; 
 970          :param string `label`: a L{GenericTreeItem} text label. 
 971          """

1058 -    def GetKeyCode(self): 

1059          """ 
1060          Returns the virtual key code. ASCII events return normal ASCII values, while 
1061          non-ASCII events return values such as ``wx.WXK_LEFT`` for the left cursor key. 
1062   
1063          This method is for ``EVT_TREE_KEY_DOWN`` events only. 
1064           
1065          :return: An integer representing the virtual key code. 
1066

1068           a character that can be represented in current locale's default charset. You can 
1069           obtain the corresponding Unicode character using `GetUnicodeKey`.

1247  # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
1248  # Auxiliary Classes: TreeTextCtrl 
1249  # This Is The Temporary ExpandoTextCtrl Created When You Edit The Text Of An Item 
1250  # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
1251   

1252 -class TreeTextCtrl(ExpandoTextCtrl): 

1253      """ 
1254      Control used for in-place edit. 
1255   
1256      This is a subclass of `wx.lib.expando.ExpandoTextCtrl` as L{CustomTreeCtrl} supports multiline 
1257      text items. 
1258   
1259      :note: To add a newline character in a multiline item, press ``Shift`` + ``Enter`` as the ``Enter`` 
1260       key alone is consumed by L{CustomTreeCtrl} to finish the editing and ``Ctrl`` + ``Enter`` is 
1261       consumed by the platform for tab navigation. 
1262      """ 
1263   

1264 -    def __init__(self, owner, item=None): 

1265          """ 
1266          Default class constructor. 
1267          For internal use: do not call it in your code! 
1268   
1269          :param `owner`: the control parent (an instance of L{CustomTreeCtrl}); 
1270          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
1271   
1272          :raise: `Exception` when the item has an associated image but the parent 
1273           L{CustomTreeCtrl} does not have a `wx.ImageList` assigned. 
1274          """ 
1275           
1276          self._owner = owner 
1277          self._itemEdited = item 
1278          self._startValue = item.GetText() 
1279          self._finished = False 
1280          self._aboutToFinish = False 
1281          self._currentValue = self._startValue 
1282   
1283          w = self._itemEdited.GetWidth() 
1284          h = self._itemEdited.GetHeight() 
1285   
1286          wnd = self._itemEdited.GetWindow() 
1287          if wnd: 
1288              w = w - self._itemEdited.GetWindowSize()[0] 
1289              h = 0 
1290   
1291          x, y = self._owner.CalcScrolledPosition(item.GetX(), item.GetY()) 
1292   
1293          image_h = 0 
1294          image_w = 0 
1295   
1296          image = item.GetCurrentImage() 
1297   
1298          if image != _NO_IMAGE: 
1299       
1300              if self._owner._imageListNormal: 
1301                  image_w, image_h = self._owner._imageListNormal.GetSize(image) 
1302                  image_w += 4 
1303           
1304              else: 
1305           
1306                  raise Exception("\n ERROR: You Must Create An Image List To Use Images!") 
1307   
1308          checkimage = item.GetCurrentCheckedImage() 
1309   
1310          if checkimage is not None: 
1311              wcheck, hcheck = self._owner._imageListCheck.GetSize(checkimage) 
1312              wcheck += 4 
1313          else: 
1314              wcheck = hcheck = 0 
1315   
1316          if wnd: 
1317              h = max(hcheck, image_h) 
1318              dc = wx.ClientDC(self._owner) 
1319              h = max(h, dc.GetTextExtent("Aq")[1]) 
1320              h = h + 2 
1321               
1322          # FIXME: what are all these hardcoded 4, 8 and 11s really? 
1323          x += image_w + wcheck 
1324          w -= image_w + 4 + wcheck 
1325   
1326          expandoStyle = wx.WANTS_CHARS 
1327          if wx.Platform in ["__WXGTK__", "__WXMAC__"]: 
1328              expandoStyle |= wx.SIMPLE_BORDER 
1329              xSize, ySize = w + 25, h 
1330          else: 
1331              expandoStyle |= wx.SUNKEN_BORDER 
1332              xSize, ySize = w + 25, h+2 
1333               
1334          ExpandoTextCtrl.__init__(self, self._owner, wx.ID_ANY, self._startValue, 
1335                                   wx.Point(x - 4, y), wx.Size(xSize, ySize), 
1336                                   expandoStyle) 
1337   
1338          if wx.Platform == "__WXMAC__": 
1339              self.SetFont(owner.GetFont()) 
1340              bs = self.GetBestSize() 
1341              self.SetSize((-1, bs.height)) 
1342           
1343          self.Bind(wx.EVT_CHAR, self.OnChar) 
1344          self.Bind(wx.EVT_KEY_UP, self.OnKeyUp) 
1345          self.Bind(wx.EVT_KILL_FOCUS, self.OnKillFocus) 

1346       
1347   

1348 -    def AcceptChanges(self): 

1349          """ 
1350          Accepts/rejects the changes made by the user. 
1351   
1352          :return: ``True`` if the changes to the item text have been accepted, ``False`` 
1353           if they have been rejected (i.e., vetoed by the user). 
1354          """ 
1355   
1356          value = self.GetValue() 
1357   
1358          if value == self._startValue: 
1359              # nothing changed, always accept 
1360              # when an item remains unchanged, the owner 
1361              # needs to be notified that the user decided 
1362              # not to change the tree item label, and that 
1363              # the edit has been cancelled 
1364              self._owner.OnCancelEdit(self._itemEdited) 
1365              return True 
1366   
1367          if not self._owner.OnAcceptEdit(self._itemEdited, value): 
1368              # vetoed by the user 
1369              return False 
1370   
1371          # accepted, do rename the item 
1372          self._owner.SetItemText(self._itemEdited, value) 
1373           
1374          return True 

1375   
1376   

1377 -    def Finish(self): 

1378          """ Finish editing. """ 
1379   
1380          if not self._finished:         
1381              self._finished = True 
1382              self._owner.SetFocusIgnoringChildren() 
1383              self._owner.ResetEditControl() 

1384           
1385   

1386 -    def OnChar(self, event): 

1387          """ 
1388          Handles the ``wx.EVT_CHAR`` event for L{TreeTextCtrl}. 
1389   
1390          :param `event`: a `wx.KeyEvent` event to be processed. 
1391          """ 
1392   
1393          keycode = event.GetKeyCode() 
1394          shiftDown = event.ShiftDown() 
1395   
1396          if keycode in [wx.WXK_RETURN, wx.WXK_NUMPAD_ENTER]: 
1397              if shiftDown: 
1398                  event.Skip() 
1399              else: 
1400                  self._aboutToFinish = True 
1401                  self.SetValue(self._currentValue) 
1402                  # Notify the owner about the changes 
1403                  self.AcceptChanges() 
1404                  # Even if vetoed, close the control (consistent with MSW) 
1405                  wx.CallAfter(self.Finish) 
1406   
1407          elif keycode == wx.WXK_ESCAPE: 
1408              self.StopEditing() 
1409   
1410          else: 
1411              event.Skip() 

1412       
1413   

1414 -    def OnKeyUp(self, event): 

1415          """ 
1416          Handles the ``wx.EVT_KEY_UP`` event for L{TreeTextCtrl}. 
1417   
1418          :param `event`: a `wx.KeyEvent` event to be processed. 
1419          """ 
1420   
1421          if not self._finished: 
1422   
1423              # auto-grow the textctrl: 
1424              parentSize = self._owner.GetSize() 
1425              myPos = self.GetPosition() 
1426              mySize = self.GetSize() 
1427   
1428              dc = wx.ClientDC(self) 
1429              sx, sy, dummy = dc.GetMultiLineTextExtent(self.GetValue() + "M") 
1430   
1431              if myPos.x + sx > parentSize.x: 
1432                  sx = parentSize.x - myPos.x 
1433              if mySize.x > sx: 
1434                  sx = mySize.x 
1435                   
1436              self.SetSize((sx, -1)) 
1437              self._currentValue = self.GetValue() 
1438   
1439          event.Skip() 

1440   
1441   

1442 -    def OnKillFocus(self, event): 

1443          """ 
1444          Handles the ``wx.EVT_KILL_FOCUS`` event for L{TreeTextCtrl}. 
1445   
1446          :param `event`: a `wx.FocusEvent` event to be processed. 
1447          """ 
1448           
1449          if not self._finished and not self._aboutToFinish: 
1450           
1451              # We must finish regardless of success, otherwise we'll get 
1452              # focus problems: 
1453               
1454              if not self.AcceptChanges(): 
1455                  self._owner.OnCancelEdit(self._itemEdited) 
1456           
1457          # We must let the native text control handle focus, too, otherwise 
1458          # it could have problems with the cursor (e.g., in wxGTK). 
1459          event.Skip() 

1460   
1461   

1462 -    def StopEditing(self): 

1463          """ Suddenly stops the editing. """ 
1464   
1465          self._owner.OnCancelEdit(self._itemEdited) 
1466          self.Finish() 

1467           
1468

1471          Returns the item currently edited. 
1472   
1473          :return: An instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
1474          """ 
1475   
1476          return self._itemEdited

1509  # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
1510  # GenericTreeItem Implementation. 
1511  # This Class Holds All The Information And Methods For Every Single Item In 
1512  # CustomTreeCtrl. 
1513  # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
1514   

1515 -class GenericTreeItem(object): 

1516      """ 
1517      This class holds all the information and methods for every single item in 
1518      L{CustomTreeCtrl}. This is a generic implementation of `wx.TreeItem`. 
1519      """ 
1520       

1521 -    def __init__(self, parent, text="", ct_type=0, wnd=None, image=-1, selImage=-1, data=None, separator=False): 

1522          """ 
1523          Default class constructor. 
1524          For internal use: do not call it in your code! 
1525   
1526          :param `parent`: the tree item parent, an instance of L{GenericTreeItem} (may 
1527           be ``None`` for root items); 
1528          :param string `text`: the tree item text; 
1529          :param integer `ct_type`: the tree item kind. May be one of the following integers: 
1530   
1531           =============== ========================================= 
1532           `ct_type` Value Description 
1533           =============== ========================================= 
1534                  0        A normal item 
1535                  1        A checkbox-like item 
1536                  2        A radiobutton-type item 
1537           =============== ========================================= 
1538   
1539          :param `wnd`: if not ``None``, a non-toplevel window to be displayed next to 
1540           the item, an instance of `wx.Window`; 
1541          :param integer `image`: an index within the normal image list specifying the image to 
1542           use for the item in unselected state; 
1543          :param integer `selImage`: an index within the normal image list specifying the image to 
1544           use for the item in selected state; if `image` > -1 and `selImage` is -1, the 
1545           same image is used for both selected and unselected items; 
1546          :param object `data`: associate the given Python object `data` with the item; 
1547          :param bool `separator`: ``True`` if the item is a separator, ``False`` otherwise.  
1548   
1549          :note: Regarding radiobutton-type items (with `ct_type` = 2), the following 
1550           approach is used: 
1551            
1552           - All peer-nodes that are radiobuttons will be mutually exclusive. In other words, 
1553             only one of a set of radiobuttons that share a common parent can be checked at 
1554             once. If a radiobutton node becomes checked, then all of its peer radiobuttons 
1555             must be unchecked. 
1556           - If a radiobutton node becomes unchecked, then all of its child nodes will become 
1557             inactive. 
1558   
1559   
1560          :note: Separator items should not have children, labels, data or an associated window. 
1561           Other issues/features associated to separator items: 
1562            
1563           - You can change the color of individual separators by using L{CustomTreeCtrl.SetItemTextColour}, 
1564             or you can use L{CustomTreeCtrl.SetSeparatorColour} to change the color of all 
1565             separators. The default separator colour is that returned by `wx.SystemSettings.GetColour(wx.SYS_COLOUR_GRAYTEXT)`; 
1566           - Separators can be selected just like any other tree item; 
1567           - Separators cannot have text; 
1568           - Separators cannot have children; 
1569           - Separators cannot be edited via the ``EVT_TREE_BEGIN_LABEL_EDIT`` event. 
1570   
1571          """ 
1572           
1573          # since there can be very many of these, we save size by chosing 
1574          # the smallest representation for the elements and by ordering 
1575          # the members to avoid padding. 
1576          self._text = text       # label to be rendered for item 
1577          self._data = data       # user-provided data 
1578   
1579          self._children  = []    # list of children 
1580          self._parent = parent   # parent of this item 
1581   
1582          self._attr = None       # attributes??? 
1583   
1584          self._separator = separator         
1585   
1586          # tree ctrl images for the normal, selected, expanded and 
1587          # expanded+selected states 
1588          self._images = [-1, -1, -1, -1] 
1589          self._images[TreeItemIcon_Normal] = image 
1590          self._images[TreeItemIcon_Selected] = selImage 
1591          self._images[TreeItemIcon_Expanded] = _NO_IMAGE 
1592          self._images[TreeItemIcon_SelectedExpanded] = _NO_IMAGE 
1593   
1594          self._checkedimages = [None, None, None, None, None] 
1595          self._leftimage = _NO_IMAGE 
1596   
1597          self._x = 0             # (virtual) offset from top 
1598          self._y = 0             # (virtual) offset from left 
1599          self._width = 0         # width of this item 
1600          self._height = 0        # height of this item 
1601   
1602          self._isCollapsed = True 
1603          self._hasHilight = False    # same as focused 
1604          self._hilightPart = 0       # 0: full; else wx.TREE_HITTEST_ONITEM[LOWER|UPPER]PART 
1605          self._hasPlus = False       # used for item which doesn't have 
1606                                      # children but has a [+] button 
1607          self._isBold = False        # render the label in bold font 
1608          self._isItalic = False      # render the label in italic font 
1609          self._ownsAttr = False      # delete attribute when done 
1610          self._type = ct_type        # item type: 0=normal, 1=check, 2=radio 
1611          self._is3State = False      # true for 3-state checkbox items 
1612          self._checked = 0           # only meaningful for check and radio items 
1613          self._enabled = True        # flag to enable/disable an item 
1614          self._hypertext = False     # indicates if the item is hypertext 
1615          self._visited = False       # visited state for an hypertext item 
1616   
1617          if self._type > 0: 
1618              # do not construct the array for normal items 
1619              self._checkedimages[TreeItemIcon_Checked] = 0 
1620              self._checkedimages[TreeItemIcon_NotChecked] = 1 
1621              self._checkedimages[TreeItemIcon_Undetermined] = 2 
1622              self._checkedimages[TreeItemIcon_Flagged] = 3 
1623              self._checkedimages[TreeItemIcon_NotFlagged] = 4 
1624           
1625          if parent: 
1626              if parent.GetType() == 2 and not parent.IsChecked(): 
1627                  # if the node parent is a radio not enabled, we are disabled 
1628                  self._enabled = False 
1629   
1630          self._wnd = wnd             # are we holding a window? 
1631   
1632          if wnd: 
1633              self.SetWindow(wnd) 

1634           
1635   

1636 -    def IsOk(self): 

1637          """ 
1638          Returns whether the item is ok or not. 
1639   
1640          :note: This method always returns ``True``, it has been added for 
1641           backward compatibility with the wxWidgets C++ implementation. 
1642          """ 
1643           
1644          return True 

1645

1647 -    def IsSeparator(self):

1678 -    def GetImage(self, which=TreeItemIcon_Normal): 

1679          """ 
1680          Returns the item image for a particular item state. 
1681   
1682          :param integer `which`: can be one of the following bits: 
1683   
1684           ================================= ======================== 
1685           Item State                        Description 
1686           ================================= ======================== 
1687           ``TreeItemIcon_Normal``           To get the normal item image 
1688           ``TreeItemIcon_Selected``         To get the selected item image (i.e. the image which is shown when the item is currently selected) 
1689           ``TreeItemIcon_Expanded``         To get the expanded image (this only makes sense for items which have children - then this image is shown when the item is expanded and the normal image is shown when it is collapsed) 
1690           ``TreeItemIcon_SelectedExpanded`` To get the selected expanded image (which is shown when an expanded item is currently selected)  
1691           ================================= ======================== 
1692   
1693          :return: An integer index that can be used to retrieve the item image inside 
1694           a `wx.ImageList`. 
1695          """ 
1696           
1697          return self._images[which]  

1698   
1699   

1700 -    def GetCheckedImage(self, which=TreeItemIcon_Checked): 

1701          """ 
1702          Returns the item check image. 
1703   
1704          :param integer `which`: can be one of the following bits: 
1705   
1706           ================================= ======================== 
1707           Item State                        Description 
1708           ================================= ======================== 
1709           ``TreeItemIcon_Checked``          To get the checkbox checked item image 
1710           ``TreeItemIcon_NotChecked``       To get the checkbox unchecked item image 
1711           ``TreeItemIcon_Undetermined``     To get the checkbox undetermined state item image 
1712           ``TreeItemIcon_Flagged``          To get the radiobutton checked image 
1713           ``TreeItemIcon_NotFlagged``       To get the radiobutton unchecked image 
1714           ================================= ======================== 
1715   
1716          :return: An integer index that can be used to retrieve the item check image inside 
1717           a `wx.ImageList`. 
1718   
1719          :note: This method is meaningful only for radio & check items. 
1720          """ 
1721

1725 -    def GetLeftImage(self):

1727          Returns the leftmost image associated to this item, i.e. the image on the 
1728          leftmost part of the client area of L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
1729   
1730          :return: An integer index that can be used to retrieve the item leftmost image inside 
1731           a `wx.ImageList`. 
1732          """

1877 -    def SetWindow(self, wnd): 

1878          """ 
1879          Sets the window associated to the item. 
1880   
1881          :param `wnd`: a non-toplevel window to be displayed next to the item, any 
1882           subclass of `wx.Window`. 
1883   
1884          :raise: `Exception` if the input `item` is a separator and `wnd` is not ``None``. 
1885          """ 
1886   
1887          if self.IsSeparator() and wnd is not None: 
1888              raise Exception("Separator items can not have an associated window") 
1889   
1890          self._wnd = wnd 
1891   
1892          if wnd.GetSizer():      # the window is a complex one hold by a sizer 
1893              size = wnd.GetBestSize() 
1894          else:                   # simple window, without sizers 
1895              size = wnd.GetSize() 
1896   
1897          # We have to bind the wx.EVT_SET_FOCUS for the associated window 
1898          # No other solution to handle the focus changing from an item in 
1899          # CustomTreeCtrl and the window associated to an item 
1900          # Do better strategies exist? 
1901          self._wnd.Bind(wx.EVT_SET_FOCUS, self.OnSetFocus) 
1902           
1903          self._height = size.GetHeight() + 2 
1904          self._width = size.GetWidth() 
1905          self._windowsize = size 
1906           
1907          # We don't show the window if the item is collapsed 
1908          if self._isCollapsed: 
1909              self._wnd.Show(False) 
1910   
1911          # The window is enabled only if the item is enabled                 
1912          self._wnd.Enable(self._enabled) 
1913          self._windowenabled = self._enabled 

1914   
1915   

1916 -    def GetWindow(self): 

1917          """ 
1918          Returns the window associated to the item (if any). 
1919   
1920          :return: An instance of any `wx.Window` derived class, excluding top-level windows. 
1921          """ 
1922   
1923          return self._wnd         

1924   
1925   

1926 -    def DeleteWindow(self): 

1927          """ Deletes the window associated to the item (if any). """ 
1928   
1929          if self._wnd: 
1930              self._wnd.Destroy() 
1931              self._wnd = None 

1932           
1933   

1934 -    def GetWindowEnabled(self):

1941          """ 
1942   
1943          if not self._wnd: 
1944              raise Exception("\nERROR: This Item Has No Window Associated") 
1945   
1946          return self._windowenabled 

1947

1949 -    def SetWindowEnabled(self, enable=True): 

1950          """ 
1951          Sets whether the associated window is enabled or not. 
1952   
1953          :param bool `enable`: ``True`` to enable the associated window, ``False`` to disable it. 
1954   
1955          :raise: `Exception` when the item has no associated window. 
1956          """ 
1957   
1958          if not self._wnd: 
1959              raise Exception("\nERROR: This Item Has No Window Associated")

1970   

1971 -    def OnSetFocus(self, event): 

1972          """ 
1973          Handles the ``wx.EVT_SET_FOCUS`` event for the window associated with the item. 
1974   
1975          :param `event`: a `wx.FocusEvent` event to be processed.         
1976          """ 
1977   
1978          treectrl = self._wnd.GetParent() 
1979          select = treectrl.GetSelection() 
1980   
1981          # If the window is associated to an item that currently is selected 
1982          # (has focus) we don't kill the focus. Otherwise we do it. 
1983          if select != self: 
1984              treectrl._hasFocus = False 
1985          else: 
1986              treectrl._hasFocus = True 
1987               
1988          event.Skip() 

1989   
1990   

1991 -    def GetType(self):

2001 -    def SetType(self, ct_type): 

2002          """ 
2003          Sets the item type. 
2004   
2005          :param integer `ct_type`: may be one of the following integers: 
2006   
2007           =============== ========================================= 
2008           `ct_type` Value Description 
2009           =============== ========================================= 
2010                  0        A normal item 
2011                  1        A checkbox-like item 
2012                  2        A radiobutton-type item 
2013           =============== ========================================= 
2014   
2015          :note: Regarding radiobutton-type items (with `ct_type` = 2), the following 
2016           approach is used: 
2017            
2018           - All peer-nodes that are radiobuttons will be mutually exclusive. In other words, 
2019             only one of a set of radiobuttons that share a common parent can be checked at 
2020             once. If a radiobutton node becomes checked, then all of its peer radiobuttons 
2021             must be unchecked. 
2022           - If a radiobutton node becomes unchecked, then all of its child nodes will become 
2023             inactive. 
2024          """ 
2025   
2026          self._type = ct_type 

2027

2200 -    def Set3StateValue(self, state): 

2201          """ 
2202          Sets the checkbox item to the given `state`. 
2203   
2204          :param integer `state`: can be one of: ``wx.CHK_UNCHECKED`` (check is off), ``wx.CHK_CHECKED`` 
2205           (check is on) or ``wx.CHK_UNDETERMINED`` (check is mixed). 
2206   
2207          :raise: `Exception` when the item is not a 3-state checkbox item. 
2208   
2209          :note: This method raises an exception when the checkbox item is a 2-state checkbox

2213          """

2216              raise Exception("Set3StateValue can only be used with 3-state checkbox items.") 
2217

2221 -    def Set3State(self, allow):

2231          """ 
2232

2234              return False

2363 -    def DeleteChildren(self, tree): 

2364          """ 
2365          Deletes the item children. 
2366   
2367          :param `tree`: the main L{CustomTreeCtrl} instance. 
2368          """ 
2369   
2370          for child in self._children: 
2371              if tree: 
2372                  tree.SendDeleteEvent(child) 
2373   
2374              child.DeleteChildren(tree) 
2375               
2376              if child == tree._select_me: 
2377                  tree._select_me = None 
2378   
2379              # We have to destroy the associated window 
2380              wnd = child.GetWindow() 
2381              if wnd: 
2382                  wnd.Destroy() 
2383                  child._wnd = None 
2384   
2385              if child in tree._itemWithWindow: 
2386                  tree._itemWithWindow.remove(child) 
2387                   
2388              del child 
2389           
2390          self._children = [] 

2391   
2392   

2393 -    def SetText(self, text): 

2394          """ 
2395          Sets the item text. 
2396   
2397          :param string `text`: the new item label. 
2398   
2399          :raise: `Exception` if the item is a separator.         
2400          """ 
2401   
2402          if self.IsSeparator(): 
2403              raise Exception("Separator items can not have text") 
2404   
2405          self._text = text

2408 -    def GetChildrenCount(self, recursively=True): 

2409          """ 
2410          Gets the number of children of this item. 
2411   
2412          :param bool `recursively`: if ``True``, returns the total number of descendants, 
2413           otherwise only one level of children is counted. 
2414          """ 
2415   
2416          count = len(self._children) 
2417           
2418          if not recursively: 
2419              return count 
2420   
2421          total = count 
2422   
2423          for n in xrange(count): 
2424              total += self._children[n].GetChildrenCount() 
2425           
2426          return total 

2427   
2428   

2429 -    def GetSize(self, x, y, theButton): 

2430          """ 
2431          Returns the item size. 
2432   
2433          :param integer `x`: the current item's x position; 
2434          :param integer `y`: the current item's y position; 
2435          :param `theButton`: an instance of the main L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
2436   
2437          :return: A tuple of (`x`, `y`) dimensions, in pixels, representing the 
2438           item's width and height. 
2439          """ 
2440   
2441          bottomY = self._y + theButton.GetLineHeight(self) 
2442   
2443          if y < bottomY: 
2444              y = bottomY 
2445   
2446          width = self._x + self._width 
2447           
2448          if x < width: 
2449              x = width 
2450   
2451          if self.IsExpanded(): 
2452              for child in self._children: 
2453                  x, y = child.GetSize(x, y, theButton) 
2454               
2455          return x, y         

2456   
2457   

2458 -    def HitTest(self, point, theCtrl, flags=0, level=0): 

2459          """ 
2460          L{HitTest} method for an item. Called from the main window L{CustomTreeCtrl.HitTest}. 
2461   
2462          :param `point`: the point to test for the hit (an instance of `wx.Point`); 
2463          :param `theCtrl`: the main L{CustomTreeCtrl} tree; 
2464          :param integer `flags`: a bitlist of hit locations; 
2465          :param integer `level`: the item's level inside the tree hierarchy. 
2466           
2467          :see: L{CustomTreeCtrl.HitTest} method for the flags explanation. 
2468          """ 
2469           
2470          # for a hidden root node, don't evaluate it, but do evaluate children 
2471          if not (level == 0 and theCtrl.HasAGWFlag(TR_HIDE_ROOT)): 
2472           
2473              # evaluate the item 
2474              h = theCtrl.GetLineHeight(self) 
2475               
2476              if point.y > self._y and point.y < self._y + h: 
2477               
2478                  y_mid = self._y + h/2 
2479   
2480                  if point.y < y_mid: 
2481                      flags |= TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMUPPERPART 
2482                  else: 
2483                      flags |= TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMLOWERPART 
2484   
2485                  xCross = self._x - theCtrl.GetSpacing() 
2486   
2487                  if wx.Platform == "__WXMAC__": 
2488                      # according to the drawing code the triangels are drawn 
2489                      # at -4 , -4  from the position up to +10/+10 max 
2490                      if point.x > xCross-4 and point.x < xCross+10 and point.y > y_mid-4 and \ 
2491                         point.y < y_mid+10 and self.HasPlus() and theCtrl.HasButtons(): 
2492   
2493                          flags |= TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMBUTTON 
2494                          return self, flags 
2495                  else: 
2496                      # 5 is the size of the plus sign 
2497                      if point.x > xCross-6 and point.x < xCross+6 and point.y > y_mid-6 and \ 
2498                         point.y < y_mid+6 and self.HasPlus() and theCtrl.HasButtons(): 
2499   
2500                          flags |= TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMBUTTON 
2501                          return self, flags 
2502   
2503                  if point.x >= self._x and point.x <= self._x + self._width: 
2504   
2505                      image_w = -1 
2506                      wcheck = 0 
2507   
2508                      # assuming every image (normal and selected) has the same size! 
2509                      if self.GetImage() != _NO_IMAGE and theCtrl._imageListNormal: 
2510                          image_w, image_h = theCtrl._imageListNormal.GetSize(self.GetImage()) 
2511   
2512                      if self.GetCheckedImage() is not None: 
2513                          wcheck, hcheck = theCtrl._imageListCheck.GetSize(self.GetCheckedImage()) 
2514   
2515                      if wcheck and point.x <= self._x + wcheck + 1: 
2516                          flags |= TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMCHECKICON 
2517                          return self, flags 
2518   
2519                      if image_w != -1 and point.x <= self._x + wcheck + image_w + 1: 
2520                          flags |= TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMICON 
2521                      else: 
2522                          flags |= TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMLABEL 
2523   
2524                      return self, flags 
2525   
2526                  if point.x < self._x: 
2527                      if theCtrl.HasAGWFlag(TR_FULL_ROW_HIGHLIGHT): 
2528                          flags |= TREE_HITTEST_ONITEM 
2529                      else: 
2530                          flags |= TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMINDENT 
2531                  if point.x > self._x + self._width: 
2532                      if theCtrl.HasAGWFlag(TR_FULL_ROW_HIGHLIGHT): 
2533                          flags |= TREE_HITTEST_ONITEM 
2534                      else: 
2535                          flags |= TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMRIGHT 
2536                           
2537                  return self, flags 
2538               
2539              # if children are expanded, fall through to evaluate them 
2540              if self._isCollapsed: 
2541                  return None, 0 
2542           
2543          # evaluate children 
2544          for child in self._children: 
2545              res, flags = child.HitTest(point, theCtrl, flags, level + 1) 
2546              if res != None: 
2547                  return res, flags 
2548   
2549          return None, 0 

2550   
2551   

2552 -    def GetCurrentImage(self): 

2553          """ 
2554          Returns the current item image. 
2555   
2556          :return: An integer index that can be used to retrieve the item image inside 
2557           a `wx.ImageList`. 
2558          """ 
2559   
2560          image = _NO_IMAGE 
2561           
2562          if self.IsExpanded(): 
2563           
2564              if self.IsSelected(): 
2565               
2566                  image = self._images[TreeItemIcon_SelectedExpanded] 
2567   
2568              if image == _NO_IMAGE: 
2569               
2570                  # we usually fall back to the normal item, but try just the 
2571                  # expanded one (and not selected) first in this case 
2572                  image = self._images[TreeItemIcon_Expanded] 
2573           
2574          else: # not expanded 
2575           
2576              if self.IsSelected(): 
2577                  image = self._images[TreeItemIcon_Selected] 
2578           
2579          # maybe it doesn't have the specific image we want, 
2580          # try the default one instead 
2581          if image == _NO_IMAGE: 
2582              image = self._images[TreeItemIcon_Normal] 
2583   
2584          return image 

2585   
2586   

2587 -    def GetCurrentCheckedImage(self): 

2588          """ 
2589          Returns the current item check image. 
2590   
2591          :return: An integer index that can be used to retrieve the item check image inside 
2592           a `wx.ImageList`. 
2593          """ 
2594   
2595          if self._type == 0: 
2596              return None 
2597   
2598          checked = self.IsChecked() 
2599           
2600          if checked > 0: 
2601              if self._type == 1:     # Checkbox 
2602                  if checked == wx.CHK_CHECKED: 
2603                      return self._checkedimages[TreeItemIcon_Checked] 
2604                  else: 
2605                      return self._checkedimages[TreeItemIcon_Undetermined]                     
2606              else:                   # Radiobutton 
2607                  return self._checkedimages[TreeItemIcon_Flagged] 
2608          else: 
2609              if self._type == 1:     # Checkbox 
2610                  return self._checkedimages[TreeItemIcon_NotChecked] 
2611              else:                   # Radiobutton 
2612                  return self._checkedimages[TreeItemIcon_NotFlagged] 

2613

2617  # This Is The Main Class. 
2618  # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
