2620 -class CustomTreeCtrl(wx.PyScrolledWindow): 

2621      """ 
2622      L{CustomTreeCtrl} is a class that mimics the behaviour of `wx.TreeCtrl`, with almost the 
2623      same base functionalities plus some more enhancements. This class does not rely on 
2624      the native control, as it is a full owner-drawn tree control. 
2625      """ 
2626   

2627 -    def __init__(self, parent, id=wx.ID_ANY, pos=wx.DefaultPosition, size=wx.DefaultSize, 
2628                   style=0, agwStyle=TR_DEFAULT_STYLE, validator=wx.DefaultValidator, 
2629                   name="CustomTreeCtrl"): 

2630          """ 
2631          Default class constructor. 
2632           
2633          :param `wx.Window` `parent`: parent window. Must not be ``None``; 
2634          :param integer `id`: window identifier. A value of -1 indicates a default value; 
2635          :param `pos`: the control position. A value of (-1, -1) indicates a default position, 
2636           chosen by either the windowing system or wxPython, depending on platform; 
2637          :type `pos`: tuple or `wx.Point` 
2638          :param `size`: the control size. A value of (-1, -1) indicates a default size, 
2639           chosen by either the windowing system or wxPython, depending on platform; 
2640          :type `size`: tuple or `wx.Size` 
2641          :param integer `style`: the underlying `wx.PyScrolledWindow` style; 
2642          :param integer `agwStyle`: the AGW-specific window style for L{CustomTreeCtrl}. It can be a 
2643           combination of the following bits: 
2644           
2645           ============================== =========== ================================================== 
2646           Window Styles                  Hex Value   Description 
2647           ============================== =========== ================================================== 
2648           ``TR_NO_BUTTONS``                      0x0 For convenience to document that no buttons are to be drawn. 
2649           ``TR_SINGLE``                          0x0 For convenience to document that only one item may be selected at a time. Selecting another item causes the current selection, if any, to be deselected. This is the default. 
2650           ``TR_HAS_BUTTONS``                     0x1 Use this style to show + and - buttons to the left of parent items. 
2651           ``TR_NO_LINES``                        0x4 Use this style to hide vertical level connectors. 
2652           ``TR_LINES_AT_ROOT``                   0x8 Use this style to show lines between root nodes. Only applicable if ``TR_HIDE_ROOT`` is set and ``TR_NO_LINES`` is not set. 
2653           ``TR_DEFAULT_STYLE``                   0x9 The set of flags that are closest to the defaults for the native control for a particular toolkit. 
2654           ``TR_TWIST_BUTTONS``                  0x10 Use old Mac-twist style buttons. 
2655           ``TR_MULTIPLE``                       0x20 Use this style to allow a range of items to be selected. If a second range is selected, the current range, if any, is deselected. 
2656           ``TR_EXTENDED``                       0x40 Use this style to allow disjoint items to be selected. (Only partially implemented; may not work in all cases). 
2657           ``TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT``        0x80 Use this style to cause row heights to be just big enough to fit the content. If not set, all rows use the largest row height. The default is that this flag is unset. 
2658           ``TR_EDIT_LABELS``                   0x200 Use this style if you wish the user to be able to edit labels in the tree control. 
2659           ``TR_ROW_LINES``                     0x400 Use this style to draw a contrasting border between displayed rows. 
2660           ``TR_HIDE_ROOT``                     0x800 Use this style to suppress the display of the root node, effectively causing the first-level nodes to appear as a series of root nodes. 
2661           ``TR_FULL_ROW_HIGHLIGHT``           0x2000 Use this style to have the background colour and the selection highlight extend  over the entire horizontal row of the tree control window. 
2662           ``TR_AUTO_CHECK_CHILD``             0x4000 Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a parent item is checked/unchecked its children are checked/unchecked as well. 
2663           ``TR_AUTO_TOGGLE_CHILD``            0x8000 Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a parent item is checked/unchecked its children are toggled accordingly. 
2664           ``TR_AUTO_CHECK_PARENT``           0x10000 Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a child item is checked/unchecked its parent item is checked/unchecked as well. 
2665           ``TR_ALIGN_WINDOWS``               0x20000 Flag used to align windows (in items with windows) at the same horizontal position. 
2666           ``TR_ALIGN_WINDOWS_RIGHT``         0x40000 Flag used to align windows (in items with windows) to the rightmost edge of L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
2667           ``TR_ELLIPSIZE_LONG_ITEMS``        0x80000 Flag used to ellipsize long items when the horizontal space for L{CustomTreeCtrl} is low. 
2668           ``TR_TOOLTIP_ON_LONG_ITEMS``      0x100000 Flag used to show tooltips on long items when the horizontal space for L{CustomTreeCtrl} is low. 
2669           ============================== =========== ================================================== 
2670   
2671          :param `wx.Validator` `validator`: window validator; 
2672          :param string `name`: window name. 
2673          """ 
2674           
2675          self._current = self._key_current = self._anchor = self._select_me = None 
2676          self._hasFocus = False 
2677          self._dirty = False 
2678   
2679          # Default line height: it will soon be changed 
2680          self._lineHeight = 10 
2681          # Item indent wrt parent 
2682          self._indent = 15 
2683          # item horizontal spacing between the start and the text 
2684          self._spacing = 18 
2685   
2686          # Brushes for focused/unfocused items (also gradient type) 
2687          self._hilightBrush = wx.Brush(wx.SystemSettings_GetColour(wx.SYS_COLOUR_HIGHLIGHT)) 
2688          btnshadow = wx.SystemSettings_GetColour(wx.SYS_COLOUR_BTNSHADOW) 
2689          self._hilightUnfocusedBrush = wx.Brush(btnshadow) 
2690          r, g, b = btnshadow.Red(), btnshadow.Green(), btnshadow.Blue() 
2691          backcolour = (max((r >> 1) - 20, 0), 
2692                        max((g >> 1) - 20, 0), 
2693                        max((b >> 1) - 20, 0)) 
2694          backcolour = wx.Colour(backcolour[0], backcolour[1], backcolour[2]) 
2695          self._hilightUnfocusedBrush2 = wx.Brush(backcolour) 
2696   
2697          # image list for icons 
2698          self._imageListNormal = self._imageListButtons = self._imageListState = self._imageListCheck = self._imageListLeft = None

2711          self._editTimer = None

2714          self._freezeCount = 0 
2715

2717          self._findTimer = None 
2718   
2719          self._dropEffectAboveItem = False 
2720          self._lastOnSame = False 
2721   
2722          # Default normal and bold fonts for an item 
2723          self._hasFont = True

2725          family = self._normalFont.GetFamily() 
2726          if family == wx.FONTFAMILY_UNKNOWN: 
2727              family = wx.FONTFAMILY_SWISS

2729                                   self._normalFont.GetStyle(), wx.BOLD, self._normalFont.GetUnderlined(), 
2730                                   self._normalFont.GetFaceName(), self._normalFont.GetEncoding())

2732                                     wx.FONTSTYLE_ITALIC, wx.NORMAL, self._normalFont.GetUnderlined(), 
2733                                     self._normalFont.GetFaceName(), self._normalFont.GetEncoding())

2738                                        self._normalFont.GetFaceName(), self._normalFont.GetEncoding()) 
2739          self._hypertextnewcolour = wx.BLUE

2761

2765          # Connection lines style 
2766          grey = (160,160,160) 
2767          if wx.Platform != "__WXMAC__": 
2768              self._dottedPen = wx.Pen(grey, 1, wx.USER_DASH) 
2769              self._dottedPen.SetDashes([1,1]) 
2770              self._dottedPen.SetCap(wx.CAP_BUTT)

2784              agwStyle |= TR_NO_LINES 
2785

2787              if major < 10:

2789

2791          # if the wxPython version is less than 2.6.2.1. 
2792          if _VERSION_STRING < "2.6.2.1":

2794          else:

2796

2803          self._agwStyle = agwStyle 
2804           
2805          # Create the default check image list

2807   
2808          # If the tree display has no buttons, but does have 
2809          # connecting lines, we can use a narrower layout.

2845

2847           mouse click. 
2848   
2849          :note: Overridden from `wx.PyScrolledWindow`.

2852          # overridden base class method, allows this ctrl to 
2853          # participate in the tab-order, etc.  It's overridable because 
2854          # of deriving this class from wx.PyScrolledWindow... 
2855          return True

2858 -    def OnDestroy(self, event):

2866          # something else?

2868              self._editTimer.Stop() 
2869              del self._editTimer 
2870              self._editTimer = None

2879 -    def GetControlBmp(self, checkbox=True, checked=False, enabled=True, x=16, y=16): 

2880          """ 
2881          Returns a native looking checkbox or radio button bitmap. 
2882           
2883          :param bool `checkbox`: ``True`` to get a checkbox image, ``False`` for a radiobutton one; 
2884          :param bool `checked`: ``True`` if the control is marked, ``False`` if it is not; 
2885          :param bool `enabled`: ``True`` if the control is enabled, ``False`` if it is not; 
2886          :param integer `x`: the width of the bitmap; 
2887          :param integer `y`: the height of the bitmap. 
2888   
2889          :return: An instance of `wx.Bitmap`, representing a native looking checkbox or radiobutton.         
2890          """ 
2891   
2892          bmp = wx.EmptyBitmap(x, y) 
2893          mdc = wx.MemoryDC(bmp) 
2894          mask = wx.Colour(0xfe, 0xfe, 0xfe) 
2895          mdc.SetBackground(wx.Brush(mask)) 
2896          mdc.Clear() 
2897           
2898          render = wx.RendererNative.Get() 
2899   
2900          if checked == wx.CHK_CHECKED: 
2901              flag = wx.CONTROL_CHECKED 
2902          elif checked == wx.CHK_UNDETERMINED: 
2903              flag = wx.CONTROL_UNDETERMINED 
2904          else: 
2905              flag = 0 
2906   
2907          if not enabled: 
2908              flag |= wx.CONTROL_DISABLED 
2909   
2910          if checkbox: 
2911              render.DrawCheckBox(self, mdc, (0, 0, x, y), flag) 
2912          else: 
2913              if _VERSION_STRING < "2.9": 
2914                  render.DrawRadioButton(self, mdc, (0, 0, x, y), flag) 
2915              else: 
2916                  render.DrawRadioBitmap(self, mdc, (0, 0, x, y), flag) 
2917   
2918          mdc.SelectObject(wx.NullBitmap) 
2919          bmp.SetMaskColour(mask) 
2920          return bmp

2923 -    def GetCount(self): 

2924          """ Returns the global number of items in the tree. """ 
2925   
2926          if not self._anchor: 
2927              # the tree is empty 
2928              return 0 
2929   
2930          count = self._anchor.GetChildrenCount() 
2931           
2932          if not self.HasAGWFlag(TR_HIDE_ROOT): 
2933              # take the root itself into account 
2934              count = count + 1 
2935           
2936          return count

2982 -    def EnableChildren(self, item, enable=True): 

2983          """ 
2984          Enables/disables the item children. 
2985   
2986          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
2987          :param bool `enable`: ``True`` to enable the children, ``False`` to disable them. 
2988   
2989          :note: This method is used internally.         
2990          """ 
2991   
2992          torefresh = False 
2993          if item.IsExpanded(): 
2994              torefresh = True 
2995   
2996          if item.GetType() == 2 and enable and not item.IsChecked(): 
2997              # We hit a radiobutton item not checked, we don't want to 
2998              # enable the children 
2999              return 
3000           
3001          child, cookie = self.GetFirstChild(item) 
3002          while child: 
3003              self.EnableItem(child, enable, torefresh=torefresh) 
3004              # Recurse on tree 
3005              if child.GetType != 2 or (child.GetType() == 2 and item.IsChecked()): 
3006                  self.EnableChildren(child, enable) 
3007              (child, cookie) = self.GetNextChild(item, cookie) 

3008   
3009   

3010 -    def EnableItem(self, item, enable=True, torefresh=True): 

3011          """ 
3012          Enables/disables an item. 
3013   
3014          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
3015          :param bool `enable`: ``True`` to enable the item, ``False`` to disable it; 
3016          :param bool `torefresh`: whether to redraw the item or not. 
3017          """ 
3018   
3019          if item.IsEnabled() == enable: 
3020              return 
3021   
3022          if not enable and item.IsSelected(): 
3023              self.SelectItem(item, False) 
3024   
3025          item.Enable(enable) 
3026          wnd = item.GetWindow() 
3027   
3028          # Handles the eventual window associated to the item         
3029          if wnd: 
3030              wndenable = item.GetWindowEnabled() 
3031              wnd.Enable(enable) 
3032           
3033          if torefresh: 
3034              # We have to refresh the item line 
3035              dc = wx.ClientDC(self) 
3036              self.CalculateSize(item, dc) 
3037              self.RefreshLine(item) 

3038

3124          :param integer `state`: can be one of: ``wx.CHK_UNCHECKED`` (check is off), ``wx.CHK_CHECKED`` 
3125           (check is on) or ``wx.CHK_UNDETERMINED`` (check is mixed).

3131          """

3142           to a 2-state checkbox.

3152 -    def CheckItem2(self, item, checked=True, torefresh=False): 

3153          """ 
3154          Used internally to avoid ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKED`` events. 
3155   
3156          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
3157          :param bool `checked`: ``True`` to check an item, ``False`` to uncheck it; 
3158          :param bool `torefresh`: whether to redraw the item or not. 
3159          """ 
3160   
3161          if item.GetType() == 0: 
3162              return 
3163           
3164          item.Check(checked) 
3165   
3166          if torefresh: 
3167              dc = wx.ClientDC(self) 
3168              self.CalculateSize(item, dc) 
3169              self.RefreshLine(item) 

3170           
3171   

3172 -    def UnCheckRadioParent(self, item, checked=False): 

3173          """ 
3174          Used internally to handle radio node parent correctly. 
3175   
3176          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
3177          :param bool `checked`: ``True`` to check an item, ``False`` to uncheck it. 
3178          """ 
3179   
3180          e = TreeEvent(wxEVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKING, self.GetId()) 
3181          e.SetItem(item) 
3182          e.SetEventObject(self) 
3183           
3184          if self.GetEventHandler().ProcessEvent(e): 
3185              return False 
3186   
3187          item.Check(checked) 
3188          self.RefreshLine(item) 
3189          self.EnableChildren(item, checked) 
3190          e = TreeEvent(wxEVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKED, self.GetId()) 
3191          e.SetItem(item) 
3192          e.SetEventObject(self) 
3193          self.GetEventHandler().ProcessEvent(e) 
3194   
3195          return True         

3196           
3197   

3198 -    def CheckItem(self, item, checked=True): 

3199          """ 
3200          Actually checks/uncheks an item, sending (eventually) the two 
3201          events ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKING`` and ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKED``. 
3202   
3203          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
3204          :param bool `checked`: for a radiobutton-type item, ``True`` to check it, ``False`` 
3205           to uncheck it. For a checkbox-type item, it can be one of ``wx.CHK_UNCHECKED`` 
3206           when the checkbox is unchecked, ``wx.CHK_CHECKED`` when it is checked and 
3207           ``wx.CHK_UNDETERMINED`` when it's in the undetermined state. 
3208          """ 
3209   
3210          # Should we raise an error here?!?         
3211          if item.GetType() == 0: 
3212              return 
3213   
3214          if item.GetType() == 2:    # it's a radio button 
3215              if not checked and item.IsChecked():  # Try To Unckeck? 
3216                  return 
3217              else: 
3218                  if not self.UnCheckRadioParent(item, checked): 
3219                      return 
3220   
3221                  self.CheckSameLevel(item, False) 
3222                  return 
3223               
3224          # Radiobuttons are done, let's handle checkbuttons... 
3225          e = TreeEvent(wxEVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKING, self.GetId()) 
3226          e.SetItem(item) 
3227          e.SetEventObject(self) 
3228           
3229          if self.GetEventHandler().ProcessEvent(e): 
3230              # Blocked by user 
3231              return  
3232   
3233          if item.Is3State(): 
3234              item.Set3StateValue(checked) 
3235          else: 
3236              item.Check(checked) 
3237               
3238          dc = wx.ClientDC(self) 
3239          self.RefreshLine(item) 
3240   
3241          if self.HasAGWFlag(TR_AUTO_CHECK_CHILD): 
3242              ischeck = self.IsItemChecked(item) 
3243              self.AutoCheckChild(item, ischeck) 
3244          if self.HasAGWFlag(TR_AUTO_CHECK_PARENT): 
3245              ischeck = self.IsItemChecked(item) 
3246              self.AutoCheckParent(item, ischeck) 
3247          elif self.HasAGWFlag(TR_AUTO_TOGGLE_CHILD): 
3248              self.AutoToggleChild(item) 
3249   
3250          e = TreeEvent(wxEVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKED, self.GetId()) 
3251          e.SetItem(item) 
3252          e.SetEventObject(self) 
3253          self.GetEventHandler().ProcessEvent(e) 

3254   
3255   

3256 -    def AutoToggleChild(self, item): 

3257          """ 
3258          Transverses the tree and toggles the items. 
3259   
3260          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
3261   
3262          :note: This method is meaningful only for checkbox-like and radiobutton-like items. 
3263          """ 
3264           
3265          child, cookie = self.GetFirstChild(item) 
3266   
3267          torefresh = False 
3268          if item.IsExpanded(): 
3269              torefresh = True 
3270   
3271          # Recurse on tree             
3272          while child: 
3273              if child.GetType() == 1 and child.IsEnabled(): 
3274                  self.CheckItem2(child, not child.IsChecked(), torefresh=torefresh) 
3275              self.AutoToggleChild(child) 
3276              (child, cookie) = self.GetNextChild(item, cookie) 

3277   
3278   

3279 -    def AutoCheckChild(self, item, checked): 

3280          """ 
3281          Transverses the tree and checks/unchecks the items. 
3282   
3283          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
3284          :param bool `checked`: ``True`` to check an item, ``False`` to uncheck it. 
3285   
3286          :note: This method is meaningful only for checkbox-like and radiobutton-like items. 
3287          """         
3288   
3289          (child, cookie) = self.GetFirstChild(item) 
3290   
3291          torefresh = False 
3292          if item.IsExpanded(): 
3293              torefresh = True 
3294               
3295          while child: 
3296              if child.GetType() == 1 and child.IsEnabled(): 
3297                  self.CheckItem2(child, checked, torefresh=torefresh) 
3298              self.AutoCheckChild(child, checked) 
3299              (child, cookie) = self.GetNextChild(item, cookie) 

3300   
3301   

3302 -    def AutoCheckParent(self, item, checked): 

3303          """ 
3304          Traverses up the tree and checks/unchecks parent items. 
3305   
3306          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
3307          :param bool `checked`: ``True`` to check an item, ``False`` to uncheck it. 
3308   
3309          :note: This method is meaningful only for checkbox-like and radiobutton-like items. 
3310          """ 
3311   
3312          parent = item.GetParent() 
3313          if not parent or parent.GetType() != 1: 
3314              return 
3315   
3316          (child, cookie) = self.GetFirstChild(parent) 
3317          while child: 
3318              if child.GetType() == 1 and child.IsEnabled(): 
3319                  if checked != child.IsChecked(): 
3320                      return 
3321              (child, cookie) = self.GetNextChild(parent, cookie) 
3322   
3323          self.CheckItem2(parent, checked, torefresh=True) 
3324          self.AutoCheckParent(parent, checked) 

3325   
3326   

3327 -    def CheckChilds(self, item, checked=True): 

3328          """ 
3329          Programatically check/uncheck item children. 
3330   
3331          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
3332          :param bool `checked`: ``True`` to check an item, ``False`` to uncheck it. 
3333   
3334          :note: This method is meaningful only for checkbox-like and radiobutton-like items. 
3335   
3336          :note: This method does not generate ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKING`` and 
3337           ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKED`` events. 
3338          """ 
3339           
3340          if checked == None: 
3341              self.AutoToggleChild(item) 
3342          else: 
3343              self.AutoCheckChild(item, checked) 

3344   
3345   

3346 -    def CheckSameLevel(self, item, checked=False): 

3347          """ 
3348          Uncheck radio items which are on the same level of the checked one. 
3349          Used internally. 
3350   
3351          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
3352          :param bool `checked`: ``True`` to check an item, ``False`` to uncheck it. 
3353   
3354          :note: This method is meaningful only for radiobutton-like items. 
3355          """ 
3356   
3357          parent = item.GetParent() 
3358   
3359          if not parent: 
3360              return 
3361   
3362          torefresh = False 
3363          if parent.IsExpanded(): 
3364              torefresh = True 
3365           
3366          (child, cookie) = self.GetFirstChild(parent) 
3367          while child: 
3368              if child.GetType() == 2 and child != item: 
3369                  self.CheckItem2(child, checked, torefresh=torefresh) 
3370                  if child.GetType != 2 or (child.GetType() == 2 and child.IsChecked()): 
3371                      self.EnableChildren(child, checked) 
3372              (child, cookie) = self.GetNextChild(parent, cookie) 

3373

3385 -    def ShouldInheritColours(self): 

3386          """ 
3387          Return ``True`` from here to allow the colours of this window to be 
3388          changed by `InheritAttributes`, returning ``False`` forbids inheriting them 
3389          from the parent window. 
3390           
3391          The base class version returns ``False``, but this method is overridden in 
3392          `wx.Control` where it returns ``True``. 
3393   
3394          L{CustomTreeCtrl} does not inherit colours from anyone. 
3395          """ 
3396   
3397          return False

3444 -    def HasAGWFlag(self, flag): 

3445          """ 
3446          Returns ``True`` if L{CustomTreeCtrl} has the `flag` bit set. 
3447   
3448          :param integer `flag`: any possible window style for L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
3449   
3450          :see: The L{__init__} method for the `flag` parameter description. 
3451          """ 
3452

3455   

3456 -    def SetAGWWindowStyleFlag(self, agwStyle): 

3457          """ 
3458          Sets the L{CustomTreeCtrl} window style. 
3459   
3460          :param integer `agwStyle`: the new L{CustomTreeCtrl} window style. 
3461           
3462          :see: The L{__init__} method for the `agwStyle` parameter description. 
3463          """ 
3464           
3465          # Do not try to expand the root node if it hasn't been created yet 
3466          if self._anchor and not self.HasAGWFlag(TR_HIDE_ROOT) and agwStyle & TR_HIDE_ROOT: 
3467           
3468              # if we will hide the root, make sure children are visible 
3469              self._anchor.SetHasPlus() 
3470              self._anchor.Expand() 
3471              self.CalculatePositions() 
3472           
3473          # right now, just sets the styles.  Eventually, we may 
3474          # want to update the inherited styles, but right now 
3475          # none of the parents has updatable styles 
3476   
3477          if self.HasAGWFlag(TR_MULTIPLE) and not (agwStyle & TR_MULTIPLE): 
3478              selections = self.GetSelections() 
3479              for select in selections[0:-1]: 
3480                  self.SelectItem(select, False) 
3481   
3482          self._agwStyle = agwStyle 
3483          self._dirty = True 

3484   
3485

3488          Returns the L{CustomTreeCtrl} style. 
3489   
3490          :see: The L{__init__} method for a list of possible style flags. 
3491          """ 
3492   
3493          return self._agwStyle

3521 -    def GetItemSize(self, item): 

3522          """ 
3523          Returns the horizontal space available in L{CustomTreeCtrl}, in pixels, to draw this item. 
3524   
3525          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
3526   
3527          .. versionadded:: 0.9.3 
3528          """ 
3529           
3530          w, h = self.GetClientSize() 
3531          xa, ya = self.CalcScrolledPosition((0, item.GetY())) 
3532           
3533          wcheck = image_w = 0 
3534           
3535          if item.GetType() != 0: 
3536              wcheck, dummy = self._imageListCheck.GetSize(item.GetType()) 
3537              wcheck += 4 
3538   
3539          image = item.GetCurrentImage() 
3540           
3541          if image != _NO_IMAGE:                     
3542              if self._imageListNormal:                         
3543                  image_w, dummy = self._imageListNormal.GetSize(image) 
3544                  image_w += 4 
3545   
3546          maxsize = w - (wcheck + image_w + item.GetX()) + xa 
3547          return maxsize

3550 -    def GetItemImage(self, item, which=TreeItemIcon_Normal): 

3551          """ 
3552          Returns the item image. 
3553   
3554          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
3555          :param integer `which`: can be one of the following bits: 
3556   
3557           ================================= ======================== 
3558           Item State                        Description 
3559           ================================= ======================== 
3560           ``TreeItemIcon_Normal``           To get the normal item image 
3561           ``TreeItemIcon_Selected``         To get the selected item image (i.e. the image which is shown when the item is currently selected) 
3562           ``TreeItemIcon_Expanded``         To get the expanded image (this only makes sense for items which have children - then this image is shown when the item is expanded and the normal image is shown when it is collapsed) 
3563           ``TreeItemIcon_SelectedExpanded`` To get the selected expanded image (which is shown when an expanded item is currently selected)  
3564           ================================= ======================== 
3565   
3566          :return: An integer index that can be used to retrieve the item image inside 
3567           a `wx.ImageList`.          
3568          """ 
3569   
3570          return item.GetImage(which)

3761 -    def SetItemDropHighlight(self, item, highlight=True): 

3762          """ 
3763          Gives the item the visual feedback for drag and drop operations.

3765   
3766          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
3767          :param bool `highlight`: ``True`` to highlight the dragged items, ``False`` otherwise. 
3768          """ 
3769

3773   
3774          item.Attr().SetTextColour(fg) 
3775          item.Attr.SetBackgroundColour(bg) 
3776          self.RefreshLine(item)

3827 -    def SetFont(self, font): 

3828          """ 
3829          Sets the L{CustomTreeCtrl} font. 
3830   
3831          :param `font`: a valid `wx.Font` instance. 
3832   
3833          :note: Overridden from `wx.PyScrolledWindow`.         
3834          """ 
3835   
3836          wx.PyScrolledWindow.SetFont(self, font) 
3837   
3838          self._normalFont = font  
3839          family = self._normalFont.GetFamily() 
3840          if family == wx.FONTFAMILY_UNKNOWN: 
3841              family = wx.FONTFAMILY_SWISS 
3842          self._boldFont = wx.Font(self._normalFont.GetPointSize(), family, 
3843                                   self._normalFont.GetStyle(), wx.BOLD, self._normalFont.GetUnderlined(), 
3844                                   self._normalFont.GetFaceName(), self._normalFont.GetEncoding()) 
3845          self._italicFont = wx.Font(self._normalFont.GetPointSize(), family, 
3846                                     wx.FONTSTYLE_ITALIC, wx.NORMAL, self._normalFont.GetUnderlined(), 
3847                                     self._normalFont.GetFaceName(), self._normalFont.GetEncoding()) 
3848   
3849          return True

4009 -    def SetFirstGradientColour(self, colour=None): 

4010          """ 
4011          Sets the first gradient colour for gradient-style selections. 
4012   
4013          :param `colour`: if not ``None``, a valid `wx.Colour` instance. Otherwise, 
4014           the colour is taken from the system value ``wx.SYS_COLOUR_HIGHLIGHT``. 
4015          """ 
4016           
4017          if colour is None: 
4018              colour = wx.SystemSettings_GetColour(wx.SYS_COLOUR_HIGHLIGHT) 
4019   
4020          self._firstcolour = colour 
4021          if self._usegradients: 
4022              self.RefreshSelected() 

4023               
4024   

4025 -    def SetSecondGradientColour(self, colour=None): 

4026          """ 
4027          Sets the second gradient colour for gradient-style selections. 
4028   
4029          :param `colour`: if not ``None``, a valid `wx.Colour` instance. Otherwise, 
4030           the colour generated is a slightly darker version of the L{CustomTreeCtrl} 
4031           background colour. 
4032          """ 
4033   
4034          if colour is None: 
4035              # No colour given, generate a slightly darker from the 
4036              # CustomTreeCtrl background colour 
4037              colour = self.GetBackgroundColour() 
4038              r, g, b = int(colour.Red()), int(colour.Green()), int(colour.Blue()) 
4039              colour = ((r >> 1) + 20, (g >> 1) + 20, (b >> 1) + 20) 
4040              colour = wx.Colour(colour[0], colour[1], colour[2]) 
4041   
4042          self._secondcolour = colour 
4043   
4044          if self._usegradients: 
4045              self.RefreshSelected() 

4046

4244 -    def SetItemWindow(self, item, wnd): 

4245          """ 
4246          Sets the window for the given item. 
4247   
4248          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
4249          :param `wnd`: if not ``None``, a non-toplevel window to be displayed next to 
4250           the item. 
4251   
4252          :raise: `Exception` if the input `item` is a separator and `wnd` is not ``None``. 
4253          """ 
4254   
4255          if item.IsSeparator() and wnd is not None: 
4256              raise Exception("Separator items can not have an associated window") 
4257   
4258          if wnd is not None: 
4259              self._hasWindows = True 
4260              if item not in self._itemWithWindow: 
4261                  self._itemWithWindow.append(item) 
4262              else: 
4263                  self.DeleteItemWindow(item) 
4264          else: 
4265              self.DeleteItemWindow(item) 
4266                   
4267          item.SetWindow(wnd) 
4268          self.CalculatePositions() 
4269          self.Refresh() 
4270          self.AdjustMyScrollbars() 

4271          
4272   

4273 -    def DeleteItemWindow(self, item): 

4274          """ 
4275          Deletes the window associated to an item (if any). 
4276   
4277          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
4278          """ 
4279   
4280          if item.GetWindow() is None: 
4281              return 
4282   
4283          item.DeleteWindow() 
4284          if item in self._itemWithWindow: 
4285              self._itemWithWindow.remove(item) 

4286           
4287

4327 -    def SetItemType(self, item, ct_type): 

4328          """ 
4329          Sets the item type. 
4330   
4331          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
4332          :param integer `ct_type`: may be one of the following integers: 
4333   
4334           =============== ========================================= 
4335           `ct_type` Value Description 
4336           =============== ========================================= 
4337                  0        A normal item 
4338                  1        A checkbox-like item 
4339                  2        A radiobutton-type item 
4340           =============== ========================================= 
4341   
4342          :note: Regarding radiobutton-type items (with `ct_type` = 2), the following 
4343           approach is used: 
4344            
4345           - All peer-nodes that are radiobuttons will be mutually exclusive. In other words, 
4346             only one of a set of radiobuttons that share a common parent can be checked at 
4347             once. If a radiobutton node becomes checked, then all of its peer radiobuttons 
4348             must be unchecked. 
4349           - If a radiobutton node becomes unchecked, then all of its child nodes will become 
4350             inactive. 
4351   
4352          """ 
4353   
4354          item.SetType(ct_type) 
4355          self.CalculatePositions() 
4356          self.Refresh() 

4357   
4358   
4359  # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
4360  # item status inquiries 
4361  # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
4362   

4363 -    def IsVisible(self, item): 

4364          """ 
4365          Returns whether the item is visible or not (i.e., its hierarchy is expanded 
4366          enough to show the item). 
4367           
4368          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
4369   
4370          :return: ``True`` if the item is visible, ``False`` if it is hidden. 
4371          """ 
4372   
4373          # An item is only visible if it's not a descendant of a collapsed item 
4374          parent = item.GetParent() 
4375   
4376          while parent: 
4377           
4378              if not parent.IsExpanded(): 
4379                  return False 
4380               
4381              parent = parent.GetParent() 
4382           
4383          startX, startY = self.GetViewStart() 
4384          clientSize = self.GetClientSize() 
4385   
4386          rect = self.GetBoundingRect(item) 
4387           
4388          if not rect: 
4389              return False 
4390          if rect.GetWidth() == 0 or rect.GetHeight() == 0: 
4391              return False 
4392          if rect.GetBottom() < 0 or rect.GetTop() > clientSize.y: 
4393              return False 
4394          if rect.GetRight() < 0 or rect.GetLeft() > clientSize.x: 
4395              return False 
4396   
4397          return True 

4398   
4399   

4400 -    def ItemHasChildren(self, item): 

4401          """ 
4402          Returns whether the item has children or not. 
4403   
4404          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
4405   
4406          :return: ``True`` if the item has children, ``False`` otherwise. 
4407          """ 
4408   
4409          # consider that the item does have children if it has the "+" button: it 
4410          # might not have them (if it had never been expanded yet) but then it 
4411          # could have them as well and it's better to err on this side rather than 
4412          # disabling some operations which are restricted to the items with 
4413          # children for an item which does have them 
4414          return item.HasPlus() 

4415   
4416   

4417 -    def IsExpanded(self, item): 

4418          """ 
4419          Returns whether the item is expanded or not. 
4420   
4421          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
4422   
4423          :return: ``True`` if the item is expanded, ``False`` if it is collapsed. 
4424          """ 
4425   
4426          return item.IsExpanded() 

4427   
4428

4437   
4438          return item.IsSelected()

4481 -    def GetFirstChild(self, item): 

4482          """ 
4483          Returns the item's first child and an integer value 'cookie'. 
4484          Call L{GetNextChild} for the next child using this very 'cookie' return 
4485          value as an input. 
4486   
4487          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
4488   
4489          :return: A tuple with the first value being an instance of L{GenericTreeItem} or ``None`` if there are no 
4490           further children, and as second value an integer parameter 'cookie'. 
4491   
4492          :note: This method returns ``None`` if there are no further children. 
4493          """ 
4494   
4495          cookie = 0 
4496          return self.GetNextChild(item, cookie) 

4497   
4498   

4499 -    def GetNextChild(self, item, cookie): 

4500          """ 
4501          Returns the item's next child. 
4502   
4503          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
4504          :param `cookie`: a parameter which is opaque for the application but is necessary 
4505           for the library to make these functions reentrant (i.e. allow more than one 
4506           enumeration on one and the same object simultaneously). 
4507   
4508          :return: A tuple with the first value being an instance of L{GenericTreeItem} or ``None`` if there are no 
4509           further children, and as second value an integer parameter 'cookie'. 
4510   
4511          :note: This method returns ``None`` if there are no further children. 
4512          """ 
4513   
4514          children = item.GetChildren() 
4515   
4516          # it's ok to cast cookie to size_t, we never have indices big enough to 
4517          # overflow "void *" 
4518   
4519          if cookie < len(children): 
4520               
4521              return children[cookie], cookie+1 
4522           
4523          else: 
4524           
4525              # there are no more of them 
4526              return None, cookie 

4527       
4528   

4529 -    def GetLastChild(self, item): 

4530          """ 
4531          Returns the item last child. 
4532   
4533          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
4534   
4535          :return: An instance of L{GenericTreeItem} or ``None`` if there are no 
4536           further children. 
4537          """ 
4538   
4539          children = item.GetChildren() 
4540          return (len(children) == 0 and [None] or [children[-1]])[0] 

4541   
4542   

4543 -    def GetNextSibling(self, item): 

4544          """ 
4545          Returns the next sibling of an item. 
4546   
4547          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
4548   
4549          :return: An instance of L{GenericTreeItem} or ``None`` if there are no 
4550           further siblings. 
4551   
4552          :note: This method returns ``None`` if there are no further siblings. 
4553          """ 
4554   
4555          i = item 
4556          parent = i.GetParent() 
4557           
4558          if parent == None: 
4559           
4560              # root item doesn't have any siblings 
4561              return None 
4562           
4563          siblings = parent.GetChildren() 
4564          index = siblings.index(i) 
4565           
4566          n = index + 1 
4567          return (n == len(siblings) and [None] or [siblings[n]])[0] 

4568   
4569   

4570 -    def GetPrevSibling(self, item): 

4571          """ 
4572          Returns the previous sibling of an item. 
4573   
4574          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
4575   
4576          :return: An instance of L{GenericTreeItem} or ``None`` if there are no 
4577           further siblings. 
4578   
4579          :note: This method returns ``None`` if there are no further siblings. 
4580          """ 
4581   
4582          i = item 
4583          parent = i.GetParent() 
4584           
4585          if parent == None: 
4586           
4587              # root item doesn't have any siblings 
4588              return None 
4589           
4590          siblings = parent.GetChildren() 
4591          index = siblings.index(i) 
4592   
4593          return (index == 0 and [None] or [siblings[index-1]])[0] 

4594   
4595   

4596 -    def GetNext(self, item): 

4597          """ 
4598          Returns the next item. Only for internal use right now. 
4599   
4600          :return: An instance of L{GenericTreeItem} or ``None`` if there are no 
4601           further items. 
4602   
4603          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
4604          """ 
4605   
4606          i = item 
4607   
4608          # First see if there are any children. 
4609          children = i.GetChildren() 
4610          if len(children) > 0: 
4611               return children[0] 
4612          else: 
4613               # Try a sibling of this or ancestor instead 
4614               p = item 
4615               toFind = None 
4616               while p and not toFind: 
4617                    toFind = self.GetNextSibling(p) 
4618                    p = self.GetItemParent(p) 
4619                     
4620               return toFind 

4621   
4622   

4623 -    def GetPrev(self, item): 

4624          """ 
4625          Returns the previous item. Only for internal use right now. 
4626   
4627          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
4628   
4629          :return: An instance of L{GenericTreeItem}         
4630          """ 
4631   
4632          # Look for a previous sibling of this item 
4633          prevSibling = self.GetPrevSibling(item) 
4634          if prevSibling: 
4635   
4636              # return it's last child or itself if has not got any children 
4637              if len(prevSibling.GetChildren()) > 0: 
4638                  return self.GetLastChild(prevSibling) 
4639   
4640              return prevSibling 
4641   
4642          # item has not got a previous sibling, return it's parent 
4643          return self.GetItemParent(item) 

4644   
4645   

4646 -    def GetNextExpanded(self, item): 

4647          """ 
4648          Returns the next expanded item after the input one. 
4649   
4650          :param `item`: an instance of L{TreeListItem}. 
4651          """                 
4652   
4653          nextSibling = self.GetNextSibling(item) 
4654          if nextSibling: 
4655              if nextSibling.IsExpanded(): 
4656                  return nextSibling 
4657   
4658              return self.GetNextExpanded(prevSibling) 
4659               
4660          return None 

4661   
4662   

4663 -    def GetPrevExpanded(self, item): 

4664          """ 
4665          Returns the previous expanded item before the input one. 
4666

4668          """                 
4669

4671          if prevSibling: 
4672              if prevSibling.IsExpanded(): 
4673                  return prevSibling 
4674   
4675              return self.GetPrevExpanded(prevSibling) 
4676

4680 -    def GetFirstVisibleItem(self): 

4681          """ 
4682          Returns the first visible item. 
4683   
4684          :return: An instance of L{GenericTreeItem} or ``None`` if there are no 
4685           visible items. 
4686          """ 
4687   
4688          id = self.GetRootItem() 
4689          if not id: 
4690              return id 
4691   
4692          while id: 
4693              if self.IsVisible(id): 
4694                  return id 
4695              id = self.GetNext(id) 
4696   
4697          return None 

4698   
4699   

4700 -    def GetNextVisible(self, item): 

4701          """ 
4702          Returns the next visible item. 
4703   
4704          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
4705   
4706          :return: An instance of L{GenericTreeItem} or ``None`` if there are no 
4707           next visible items. 
4708          """ 
4709   
4710          id = item 
4711   
4712          while id: 
4713              id = self.GetNext(id) 
4714              if id and self.IsVisible(id): 
4715                  return id 
4716               
4717          return None 

4718   
4719   

4720 -    def GetPrevVisible(self, item): 

4721          """ 
4722          Returns the previous visible item. 
4723   
4724          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
4725   
4726          :return: An instance of L{GenericTreeItem} or ``None`` if there are no 
4727           previous visible items. 
4728          """ 
4729    
4730          # find a previous sibling or parent which is visible 
4731          lastGoodItem = self.GetPrevSibling(item) 
4732          if not lastGoodItem or not self.IsVisible(lastGoodItem): 
4733              parent = self.GetItemParent(item) 
4734              rootHidden = self.HasAGWFlag(TR_HIDE_ROOT) 
4735              rootItem = self.GetRootItem() 
4736    
4737              while parent and not (rootHidden and parent == rootItem): 
4738                  if self.IsVisible(parent): 
4739                      lastGoodItem = parent 
4740                      break 
4741                  parent = self.GetItemParent(parent) 
4742   
4743              if not lastGoodItem: 
4744                  return None 
4745               
4746          # test if found item has visible children, if so and if the found item is not the  
4747          # parent of the current item traverse the found item to the last visible child 
4748          if not self.HasChildren(lastGoodItem) or not self.IsExpanded(lastGoodItem) or \ 
4749             (self.GetItemParent(item) == lastGoodItem): 
4750              return lastGoodItem 
4751           
4752          lastChild = self.GetLastChild(lastGoodItem) 
4753          while lastChild and self.IsVisible(lastChild): 
4754              lastGoodItem = lastChild 
4755              lastChild = self.GetLastChild(lastGoodItem) 
4756    
4757          return lastGoodItem 

4758   
4759   

4760 -    def ResetEditControl(self): 

4761          """ Called by L{TreeTextCtrl} when it marks itself for deletion. """ 
4762   
4763          if self._editCtrl is not None: 
4764              self._editCtrl.Destroy() 
4765              self._editCtrl = None 
4766   
4767          self.CalculatePositions() 
4768          self.Refresh() 
4769          self.AdjustMyScrollbars()

4772 -    def FindItem(self, idParent, prefixOrig): 

4773          """ 
4774          Finds the first item starting with the given prefix after the given parent. 
4775   
4776          :param integer `idParent`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
4777          :param string `prefixOrig`: a string containing the item text prefix. 
4778   
4779          :return: An instance of L{GenericTreeItem} or ``None`` if no item has been found.         
4780          """ 
4781   
4782          # match is case insensitive as this is more convenient to the user: having 
4783          # to press Shift-letter to go to the item starting with a capital letter 
4784          # would be too bothersome 
4785          prefix = prefixOrig.lower() 
4786   
4787          # determine the starting point: we shouldn't take the current item (this 
4788          # allows to switch between two items starting with the same letter just by 
4789          # pressing it) but we shouldn't jump to the next one if the user is 
4790          # continuing to type as otherwise he might easily skip the item he wanted 
4791          id = idParent 
4792   
4793          if len(prefix) == 1: 
4794              id = self.GetNext(id) 
4795           
4796          # look for the item starting with the given prefix after it 
4797          while id and not self.GetItemText(id).lower().startswith(prefix): 
4798           
4799              id = self.GetNext(id) 
4800           
4801          # if we haven't found anything... 
4802          if not id: 
4803           
4804              # ... wrap to the beginning 
4805              id = self.GetRootItem() 
4806              if self.HasAGWFlag(TR_HIDE_ROOT): 
4807                  # can't select virtual root 
4808                  id = self.GetNext(id) 
4809                  if idParent == self.GetRootItem():  
4810                      # no tree item selected and idParent is not reachable  
4811                      return id  
4812               
4813              # and try all the items (stop when we get to the one we started from) 
4814              while id != idParent and not self.GetItemText(id).lower().startswith(prefix): 
4815                  id = self.GetNext(id) 
4816               
4817          return id 

4818   
4819   
4820  # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
4821  # operations 
4822  # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
4823   

4824 -    def DoInsertItem(self, parentId, previous, text, ct_type=0, wnd=None, image=-1, selImage=-1, data=None, separator=False): 

4825          """ 
4826          Actually inserts an item in the tree. 
4827   
4828          :param `parentId`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem} representing the 
4829           item's parent; 
4830          :param integer `previous`: the index at which we should insert the item; 
4831          :param string `text`: the item text label; 
4832          :param integer `ct_type`: the item type (see L{SetItemType} for a list of valid 
4833           item types); 
4834          :param `wnd`: if not ``None``, a non-toplevel window to show next to the item, any 
4835           subclass of `wx.Window` except top-level windows; 
4836          :param integer `image`: an index within the normal image list specifying the image to 
4837           use for the item in unselected state; 
4838          :param integer `selImage`: an index within the normal image list specifying the image to 
4839           use for the item in selected state; if `image` > -1 and `selImage` is -1, the 
4840           same image is used for both selected and unselected items; 
4841          :param object `data`: associate the given Python object `data` with the item; 
4842          :param bool `separator`: ``True`` if the item is a separator, ``False`` otherwise.  
4843   
4844          :return: An instance of L{GenericTreeItem} upon successful insertion. 
4845   
4846          :raise: `Exception` in the following cases: 
4847   
4848           - The item window is not ``None`` but the ``TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT`` flag has not been 
4849             set for L{CustomTreeCtrl}; 
4850           - The item has multiline text (with line-breaks in it) but the ``TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT`` 
4851             flag has not been set for L{CustomTreeCtrl}; 
4852           - The `ct_type` attribute is less than ``0`` or greater than ``2``; 
4853           - The parent item is a separator; 
4854           - The item is a separator but it has text or an associated window. 
4855   
4856   
4857          :note: Separator items should not have children, text labels or an associated window.         
4858          """ 
4859   
4860          if wnd is not None and not self.HasAGWFlag(TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT): 
4861              raise Exception("\nERROR: In Order To Append/Insert Controls You Have To Use The Style TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT") 
4862   
4863          if text.find("\n") >= 0 and not self.HasAGWFlag(TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT): 
4864              raise Exception("\nERROR: In Order To Append/Insert A MultiLine Text You Have To Use The Style TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT") 
4865   
4866          if ct_type < 0 or ct_type > 2: 
4867              raise Exception("\nERROR: Item Type Should Be 0 (Normal), 1 (CheckBox) or 2 (RadioButton). ") 
4868   
4869          if separator: 
4870              if wnd: 
4871                  raise Exception("Separator items can not have associated windows") 
4872              if text.strip(): 
4873                  raise Exception("Separator items can not text labels") 
4874           
4875          parent = parentId 
4876           
4877          if not parent: 
4878              # should we give a warning here? 
4879              return self.AddRoot(text, ct_type, wnd, image, selImage, data) 
4880           
4881          self._dirty = True     # do this first so stuff below doesn't cause flicker 
4882   
4883          item = GenericTreeItem(parent, text, ct_type, wnd, image, selImage, data, separator) 
4884           
4885          if wnd is not None: 
4886              self._hasWindows = True 
4887              self._itemWithWindow.append(item) 
4888           
4889          parent.Insert(item, previous) 
4890   
4891          return item 

4892   
4893   

4894 -    def AddRoot(self, text, ct_type=0, wnd=None, image=-1, selImage=-1, data=None): 

4895          """ 
4896          Adds a root item to the L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
4897   
4898          :param string `text`: the item text label; 
4899          :param integer `ct_type`: the item type (see L{SetItemType} for a list of valid 
4900           item types); 
4901          :param `wnd`: if not ``None``, a non-toplevel window to show next to the item, 
4902           any subclass of `wx.Window` except top-level windows; 
4903          :param integer `image`: an index within the normal image list specifying the image to 
4904           use for the item in unselected state; 
4905          :param  integer `selImage`: an index within the normal image list specifying the image to 
4906           use for the item in selected state; if `image` > -1 and `selImage` is -1, the 
4907           same image is used for both selected and unselected items; 
4908          :param object `data`: associate the given Python object `data` with the item. 
4909   
4910          :return: An instance of L{GenericTreeItem} upon successful insertion. 
4911   
4912          :raise: `Exception` in the following cases: 
4913   
4914           - There already is a root item in the tree; 
4915           - The item window is not ``None`` but the ``TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT`` flag has not been 
4916             set for L{CustomTreeCtrl}; 
4917           - The item has multiline text (with line-breaks in it) but the ``TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT`` 
4918             flag has not been set for L{CustomTreeCtrl}; 
4919           - The `ct_type` attribute is less than ``0`` or greater than ``2``. 
4920   
4921          :warning: only one root is allowed to exist in any given instance of L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
4922          """ 
4923   
4924          if self._anchor: 
4925              raise Exception("\nERROR: Tree Can Have Only One Root") 
4926   
4927          if wnd is not None and not self.HasAGWFlag(TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT): 
4928              raise Exception("\nERROR: In Order To Append/Insert Controls You Have To Use The Style TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT") 
4929   
4930          if text.find("\n") >= 0 and not self.HasAGWFlag(TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT): 
4931              raise Exception("\nERROR: In Order To Append/Insert A MultiLine Text You Have To Use The Style TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT") 
4932   
4933          if ct_type < 0 or ct_type > 2: 
4934              raise Exception("\nERROR: Item Type Should Be 0 (Normal), 1 (CheckBox) or 2 (RadioButton). ") 
4935   
4936          self._dirty = True     # do this first so stuff below doesn't cause flicker 
4937   
4938          self._anchor = GenericTreeItem(None, text, ct_type, wnd, image, selImage, data) 
4939           
4940          if wnd is not None: 
4941              self._hasWindows = True 
4942              self._itemWithWindow.append(self._anchor)             
4943           
4944          if self.HasAGWFlag(TR_HIDE_ROOT): 
4945           
4946              # if root is hidden, make sure we can navigate 
4947              # into children 
4948              self._anchor.SetHasPlus() 
4949              self._anchor.Expand() 
4950              self.CalculatePositions() 
4951           
4952          if not self.HasAGWFlag(TR_MULTIPLE): 
4953           
4954              self._current = self._key_current = self._anchor 
4955              self._current.SetHilight(True) 
4956           
4957          return self._anchor 

4958   
4959

4982          """ 
4983

4992           item's parent;

5004           same image is used for both selected and unselected items;

5013          """

5066 -    def InsertItem(self, parentId, input, text, ct_type=0, wnd=None, image=-1, selImage=-1, data=None, separator=False): 

5067          """

5069

5147 -    def PrependSeparator(self, parent): 

5148          """ 
5149          Prepends a separator item as a first child of parent.

5151          :param `parent`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem} representing the

5153   
5154          :return: An instance of L{GenericTreeItem} upon successful insertion. 
5155   
5156          :see: L{DoInsertItem} for possible exceptions generated by this method.         
5157          """ 
5158   
5159          return self.PrependItem(parent, 0, separator=True)

5162 -    def SendDeleteEvent(self, item): 

5163          """ 
5164          Actually sends the ``EVT_TREE_DELETE_ITEM`` event.

5167          """

5171          event.SetEventObject(self)

5175 -    def IsDescendantOf(self, parent, item): 

5176          """ 
5177          Checks if the given item is under another one in the tree hierarchy. 
5178   
5179          :param `parent`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}, representing the possible 
5180           parent of `item`; 
5181          :param `item`: another instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
5182   
5183          :return: ``True`` if `item` is a descendant of `parent`, ``False`` otherwise.         
5184          """ 
5185   
5186          while item: 
5187           
5188              if item == parent: 
5189               
5190                  # item is a descendant of parent 
5191                  return True 
5192               
5193              item = item.GetParent() 
5194           
5195          return False 

5196   
5197   
5198      # Don't leave edit or selection on a child which is about to disappear 

5199 -    def ChildrenClosing(self, item): 

5200          """ 
5201          We are about to destroy the item children. 
5202   
5203          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
5204          """ 
5205   
5206          if self._editCtrl != None and item != self._editCtrl.item() and self.IsDescendantOf(item, self._editCtrl.item()): 
5207              self._editCtrl.StopEditing() 
5208           
5209          if item != self._key_current and self.IsDescendantOf(item, self._key_current): 
5210              self._key_current = None 
5211           
5212          if self.IsDescendantOf(item, self._select_me): 
5213              self._select_me = item 
5214           
5215          if item != self._current and self.IsDescendantOf(item, self._current): 
5216              self._current.SetHilight(False) 
5217              self._current = None 
5218              self._select_me = item 

5219

5221 -    def DeleteChildren(self, item): 

5222          """ 
5223          Delete all the item's children. 
5224   
5225          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
5226          """ 
5227   
5228          self._dirty = True     # do this first so stuff below doesn't cause flicker 
5229

5231          item.DeleteChildren(self)

5234 -    def Delete(self, item): 

5235          """ 
5236          Deletes an item. 
5237   
5238          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
5239   
5240          :note: This method sends the ``EVT_TREE_DELETE_ITEM`` event.         
5241          """ 
5242   
5243          self._dirty = True     # do this first so stuff below doesn't cause flicker 
5244   
5245          if self._editCtrl != None and self.IsDescendantOf(item, self._editCtrl.item()): 
5246              # can't delete the item being edited, cancel editing it first 
5247              self._editCtrl.StopEditing() 
5248           
5249          parent = item.GetParent() 
5250   
5251          # don't keep stale pointers around! 
5252          if self.IsDescendantOf(item, self._key_current): 
5253           
5254              # Don't silently change the selection: 
5255              # do it properly in idle time, so event 
5256              # handlers get called. 
5257   
5258              # self._key_current = parent 
5259              self._key_current = None 
5260           
5261          # self._select_me records whether we need to select 
5262          # a different item, in idle time. 
5263          if self._select_me and self.IsDescendantOf(item, self._select_me): 
5264              self._select_me = parent 
5265           
5266          if self.IsDescendantOf(item, self._current): 
5267           
5268              # Don't silently change the selection: 
5269              # do it properly in idle time, so event 
5270              # handlers get called. 
5271   
5272              # self._current = parent 
5273              self._current = None 
5274              self._select_me = parent 
5275           
5276          # remove the item from the tree 
5277          if parent: 
5278           
5279              parent.GetChildren().remove(item)  # remove by value 
5280           
5281          else: # deleting the root 
5282           
5283              # nothing will be left in the tree 
5284              self._anchor = None 
5285           
5286          # and delete all of its children and the item itself now 
5287          item.DeleteChildren(self) 
5288          self.SendDeleteEvent(item) 
5289   
5290          if item == self._select_me: 
5291              self._select_me = None 
5292   
5293          # Remove the item with window 
5294          if item in self._itemWithWindow: 
5295              wnd = item.GetWindow() 
5296              wnd.Hide() 
5297              wnd.Destroy() 
5298              item._wnd = None 
5299              self._itemWithWindow.remove(item) 
5300               
5301          del item 

5302   
5303   

5304 -    def DeleteAllItems(self): 

5305          """ Deletes all items in the L{CustomTreeCtrl}. """ 
5306   
5307          if self._anchor: 
5308              self.Delete(self._anchor) 

5309

5311 -    def Expand(self, item): 

5312          """ 
5313          Expands an item, sending a ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDING`` and 
5314          ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDED`` events. 
5315   
5316          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}.         
5317   
5318          :raise: `Exception` if you try to expand a hidden root (i.e., when the ``TR_HIDE_ROOT`` 
5319           style is set for L{CustomTreeCtrl}). 
5320          """ 
5321           
5322          if self.HasAGWFlag(TR_HIDE_ROOT) and item == self.GetRootItem(): 
5323               raise Exception("\nERROR: Can't Expand An Hidden Root. ") 
5324   
5325          if not item.HasPlus(): 
5326              return 
5327   
5328          if item.IsExpanded(): 
5329              return 
5330   
5331          if self._sendEvent: 
5332              event = TreeEvent(wxEVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDING, self.GetId()) 
5333              event._item = item 
5334              event.SetEventObject(self) 
5335   
5336              if self.GetEventHandler().ProcessEvent(event) and not event.IsAllowed(): 
5337                  # cancelled by program 
5338                  return 
5339       
5340          item.Expand() 
5341           
5342          if not self._sendEvent: 
5343              # We are in ExpandAll/ExpandAllChildren 
5344              return 
5345   
5346          self.CalculatePositions() 
5347          self.RefreshSubtree(item) 
5348   
5349          if self._hasWindows: 
5350              # We hide the associated window here, we may show it after 
5351              self.HideWindows() 
5352               
5353          event.SetEventType(wxEVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDED) 
5354          self.GetEventHandler().ProcessEvent(event) 

5355   
5356   

5357 -    def ExpandAllChildren(self, item): 

5358          """ 
5359          Expands all the items children of the input item. 
5360   
5361          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
5362   
5363          :note: This method suppresses the ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDING`` and 
5364           ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDED`` events because expanding many items int the 
5365           control would be too slow then. 
5366          """ 
5367   
5368          self._sendEvent = False         
5369          if not self.HasAGWFlag(TR_HIDE_ROOT) or item != self.GetRootItem(): 
5370              self.Expand(item) 
5371              if not self.IsExpanded(item): 
5372                  self._sendEvent = True 
5373                  return 
5374           
5375          child, cookie = self.GetFirstChild(item) 
5376           
5377          while child: 
5378              self.ExpandAllChildren(child) 
5379              child, cookie = self.GetNextChild(item, cookie) 
5380   
5381          self._sendEvent = True 

5382           
5383   

5384 -    def ExpandAll(self):

5387   
5388          :note: This method suppresses the ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDING`` and 
5389           ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDED`` events because expanding many items int the 
5390           control would be too slow then. 
5391          """ 
5392   
5393          if self._anchor: 
5394              self.ExpandAllChildren(self._anchor) 
5395   
5396          self._sendEvent = True 
5397          self._dirty = True

5400 -    def Collapse(self, item):

5402          Collapse an item, sending a ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_COLLAPSING`` and 
5403          ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_COLLAPSED`` events. 
5404   
5405          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}.

5408           style is set for L{CustomTreeCtrl}). 
5409          """

5413

5415              return

5517              self.RefreshLine(item) 
5518

5536 -    def SelectAll(self):

5541   
5542          :note: This method can be used only if L{CustomTreeCtrl} has the ``TR_MULTIPLE`` or ``TR_EXTENDED`` 
5543           style set. 
5544          """

5546          if not self.HasAGWFlag(TR_MULTIPLE) and not self.HasAGWFlag(TR_EXTENDED): 
5547              raise Exception("SelectAll can be used only with multiple selection enabled.") 
5548

5554   
5555                   
5556      # Recursive function ! 
5557      # To stop we must have crt_item<last_item 
5558      # Algorithm : 
5559      # Tag all next children, when no more children, 
5560      # Move to parent (not to tag) 
5561      # Keep going... if we found last_item, we stop. 
5562   

5563 -    def TagNextChildren(self, crt_item, last_item, select): 

5564          """ Used internally. """ 
5565   
5566          parent = crt_item.GetParent() 
5567   
5568          if parent == None: # This is root item 
5569              return self.TagAllChildrenUntilLast(crt_item, last_item, select) 
5570   
5571          children = parent.GetChildren() 
5572          index = children.index(crt_item) 
5573           
5574          count = len(children) 
5575           
5576          for n in xrange(index+1, count): 
5577              if self.TagAllChildrenUntilLast(children[n], last_item, select): 
5578                  return True 
5579   
5580          return self.TagNextChildren(parent, last_item, select) 

5581   
5582   

5583 -    def TagAllChildrenUntilLast(self, crt_item, last_item, select): 

5584          """ Used internally. """ 
5585   
5586          crt_item.SetHilight(select) 
5587          self.RefreshLine(crt_item) 
5588   
5589          if crt_item == last_item: 
5590              return True 
5591   
5592          if crt_item.HasChildren():         
5593              for child in crt_item.GetChildren(): 
5594                  if self.TagAllChildrenUntilLast(child, last_item, select): 
5595                      return True 
5596               
5597          return False 

5598
