7557 -    def OnMouse(self, event): 

7558          """ 
7559          Handles a bunch of ``wx.EVT_MOUSE_EVENTS`` events for L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
7560   
7561          :param `event`: a `wx.MouseEvent` event to be processed. 
7562          """ 
7563   
7564          if not self._anchor: 
7565              return 
7566   
7567          pt = self.CalcUnscrolledPosition(event.GetPosition()) 
7568   
7569          # Is the mouse over a tree item button? 
7570          flags = 0 
7571          thisItem, flags = self._anchor.HitTest(pt, self, flags, 0) 
7572          underMouse = thisItem 
7573          underMouseChanged = underMouse != self._underMouse 
7574   
7575          if underMouse and (flags & TREE_HITTEST_ONITEM) and not event.LeftIsDown() and \ 
7576             not self._isDragging and (not self._editTimer or not self._editTimer.IsRunning()): 
7577              underMouse = underMouse 
7578          else: 
7579              underMouse = None 
7580   
7581          if underMouse != self._underMouse: 
7582              if self._underMouse: 
7583                  # unhighlight old item 
7584                  self._underMouse = None 
7585                
7586              self._underMouse = underMouse 
7587   
7588          # Determines what item we are hovering over and need a tooltip for 
7589          hoverItem = thisItem 
7590   
7591          # We do not want a tooltip if we are dragging, or if the edit timer is running 
7592          if underMouseChanged and not self._isDragging and (not self._editTimer or not self._editTimer.IsRunning()): 
7593               
7594              if hoverItem is not None: 
7595                  # Ask the tree control what tooltip (if any) should be shown 
7596                  hevent = TreeEvent(wxEVT_TREE_ITEM_GETTOOLTIP, self.GetId()) 
7597                  hevent._item = hoverItem 
7598                  hevent.SetEventObject(self) 
7599   
7600                  if self.GetEventHandler().ProcessEvent(hevent) and hevent.IsAllowed(): 
7601                      self.SetToolTip(hevent._label) 
7602                   
7603                  elif self.HasAGWFlag(TR_TOOLTIP_ON_LONG_ITEMS): 
7604   
7605                      tip = self.GetToolTipString() 
7606   
7607                      if hoverItem.IsSeparator(): 
7608                          if tip: 
7609                              self.SetToolTipString('') 
7610                      else:                         
7611                          maxsize = self.GetItemSize(hoverItem) 
7612                          itemText = hoverItem.GetText() 
7613   
7614                          dc = wx.ClientDC(self) 
7615                           
7616                          if dc.GetMultiLineTextExtent(itemText)[0] > maxsize: 
7617                              if tip != itemText: 
7618                                  self.SetToolTipString(itemText) 
7619                          else: 
7620                              if tip: 
7621                                  self.SetToolTipString('') 
7622                           
7623                  if hoverItem.IsHyperText() and (flags & TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMLABEL) and hoverItem.IsEnabled(): 
7624                      self.SetCursor(wx.StockCursor(wx.CURSOR_HAND)) 
7625                      self._isonhyperlink = True 
7626                  else: 
7627                      if self._isonhyperlink: 
7628                          self.SetCursor(wx.StockCursor(wx.CURSOR_ARROW)) 
7629                          self._isonhyperlink = False 
7630                   
7631          # we process left mouse up event (enables in-place edit), right down 
7632          # (pass to the user code), left dbl click (activate item) and 
7633          # dragging/moving events for items drag-and-drop 
7634   
7635          if not (event.LeftDown() or event.LeftUp() or event.RightDown() or event.LeftDClick() or \ 
7636                  event.Dragging() or ((event.Moving() or event.RightUp()) and self._isDragging)): 
7637           
7638              event.Skip() 
7639              return 
7640                       
7641          flags = 0 
7642          item, flags = self._anchor.HitTest(pt, self, flags, 0) 
7643   
7644          if event.Dragging() and not self._isDragging and ((flags & TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMICON) or (flags & TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMLABEL)): 
7645           
7646              if self._dragCount == 0: 
7647                  self._dragStart = pt 
7648   
7649              self._countDrag = 0 
7650              self._dragCount = self._dragCount + 1 
7651   
7652              if self._dragCount != 3: 
7653                  # wait until user drags a bit further... 
7654                  return 
7655               
7656              command = (event.RightIsDown() and [wxEVT_TREE_BEGIN_RDRAG] or [wxEVT_TREE_BEGIN_DRAG])[0] 
7657   
7658              nevent = TreeEvent(command, self.GetId()) 
7659              nevent._item = self._current 
7660              nevent.SetEventObject(self) 
7661              newpt = self.CalcScrolledPosition(pt) 
7662              nevent.SetPoint(newpt) 
7663   
7664              # by default the dragging is not supported, the user code must 
7665              # explicitly allow the event for it to take place 
7666              nevent.Veto() 
7667   
7668              if self.GetEventHandler().ProcessEvent(nevent) and nevent.IsAllowed(): 
7669                   
7670                  # we're going to drag this item 
7671                  self._isDragging = True 
7672   
7673                  # remember the old cursor because we will change it while 
7674                  # dragging 
7675                  self._oldCursor = self._cursor 
7676   
7677                  # in a single selection control, hide the selection temporarily 
7678                  if not (self.GetAGWWindowStyleFlag() & TR_MULTIPLE): 
7679                      self._oldSelection = self.GetSelection() 
7680   
7681                      if self._oldSelection: 
7682                       
7683                          self._oldSelection.SetHilight(False) 
7684                          self.RefreshLine(self._oldSelection) 
7685                  else: 
7686                      selections = self.GetSelections() 
7687                      if len(selections) == 1: 
7688                          self._oldSelection = selections[0] 
7689                          self._oldSelection.SetHilight(False) 
7690                          self.RefreshLine(self._oldSelection) 
7691   
7692                  if self._dragImage: 
7693                      del self._dragImage 
7694   
7695                  # Create the custom draw image from the icons and the text of the item                     
7696                  self._dragImage = DragImage(self, self._current) 
7697                  self._dragImage.BeginDrag(wx.Point(0,0), self) 
7698                  self._dragImage.Show() 
7699                  self._dragImage.Move(self.CalcScrolledPosition(pt)) 
7700               
7701          elif event.Dragging() and self._isDragging: 
7702   
7703              self._dragImage.Move(self.CalcScrolledPosition(pt)) 
7704   
7705              if self._countDrag == 0 and item: 
7706                  self._oldItem = item 
7707   
7708              if item != self._dropTarget: 
7709                       
7710                  # unhighlight the previous drop target 
7711                  if self._dropTarget: 
7712                      self._dropTarget.SetHilight(False) 
7713                      self.RefreshLine(self._dropTarget) 
7714                  if item: 
7715                      item.SetHilight(True) 
7716                      self.RefreshLine(item) 
7717                      self._countDrag = self._countDrag + 1 
7718                  self._dropTarget = item 
7719   
7720                  self.Update() 
7721   
7722              if self._countDrag >= 3: 
7723                  # Here I am trying to avoid ugly repainting problems... hope it works 
7724                  self.RefreshLine(self._oldItem) 
7725                  self._countDrag = 0 
7726   
7727          elif (event.LeftUp() or event.RightUp()) and self._isDragging: 
7728   
7729              if self._dragImage: 
7730                  self._dragImage.EndDrag() 
7731   
7732              if self._dropTarget: 
7733                  self._dropTarget.SetHilight(False) 
7734                   
7735              if self._oldSelection: 
7736               
7737                  self._oldSelection.SetHilight(True) 
7738                  self.RefreshLine(self._oldSelection) 
7739                  self._oldSelection = None 
7740               
7741              # generate the drag end event 
7742              event = TreeEvent(wxEVT_TREE_END_DRAG, self.GetId()) 
7743              event._item = item 
7744              event._pointDrag = self.CalcScrolledPosition(pt) 
7745              event.SetEventObject(self) 
7746   
7747              self.GetEventHandler().ProcessEvent(event) 
7748   
7749              self._isDragging = False 
7750              self._dropTarget = None 
7751               
7752              self.SetCursor(self._oldCursor) 
7753   
7754              if wx.Platform in ["__WXMSW__", "__WXMAC__"]: 
7755                  self.Refresh() 
7756              else: 
7757                  # Probably this is not enough on GTK. Try a Refresh() if it does not work. 
7758                  wx.YieldIfNeeded() 
7759           
7760          else: 
7761   
7762              # If we got to this point, we are not dragging or moving the mouse. 
7763              # Because the code in carbon/toplevel.cpp will only set focus to the tree 
7764              # if we skip for EVT_LEFT_DOWN, we MUST skip this event here for focus to work. 
7765              # We skip even if we didn't hit an item because we still should 
7766              # restore focus to the tree control even if we didn't exactly hit an item. 
7767              if event.LeftDown(): 
7768                  self._hasFocus = True 
7769                  self.SetFocusIgnoringChildren() 
7770                  event.Skip() 
7771               
7772              # here we process only the messages which happen on tree items 
7773   
7774              self._dragCount = 0 
7775   
7776              if item == None: 
7777                  if self._editCtrl != None and item != self._editCtrl.item(): 
7778                      self._editCtrl.StopEditing() 
7779                  return  # we hit the blank area 
7780   
7781              if event.RightDown(): 
7782                   
7783                  if self._editCtrl != None and item != self._editCtrl.item(): 
7784                      self._editCtrl.StopEditing() 
7785   
7786                  self._hasFocus = True 
7787                  self.SetFocusIgnoringChildren() 
7788                       
7789                  # If the item is already selected, do not update the selection. 
7790                  # Multi-selections should not be cleared if a selected item is clicked. 
7791                  if not self.IsSelected(item): 
7792                   
7793                      self.DoSelectItem(item, True, False) 
7794   
7795                  nevent = TreeEvent(wxEVT_TREE_ITEM_RIGHT_CLICK, self.GetId()) 
7796                  nevent._item = item 
7797                  nevent._pointDrag = self.CalcScrolledPosition(pt) 
7798                  nevent.SetEventObject(self) 
7799                  event.Skip(not self.GetEventHandler().ProcessEvent(nevent)) 
7800   
7801                  # Consistent with MSW (for now), send the ITEM_MENU *after* 
7802                  # the RIGHT_CLICK event. TODO: This behaviour may change. 
7803                  nevent2 = TreeEvent(wxEVT_TREE_ITEM_MENU, self.GetId()) 
7804                  nevent2._item = item 
7805                  nevent2._pointDrag = self.CalcScrolledPosition(pt) 
7806                  nevent2.SetEventObject(self) 
7807                  self.GetEventHandler().ProcessEvent(nevent2) 
7808               
7809              elif event.LeftUp(): 
7810               
7811                  # this facilitates multiple-item drag-and-drop 
7812   
7813                  if self.HasAGWFlag(TR_MULTIPLE): 
7814                   
7815                      selections = self.GetSelections() 
7816   
7817                      if len(selections) > 1 and not event.CmdDown() and not event.ShiftDown(): 
7818                       
7819                          self.DoSelectItem(item, True, False) 
7820                       
7821                  if self._lastOnSame: 
7822                   
7823                      if item == self._current and (flags & TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMLABEL) and self.HasAGWFlag(TR_EDIT_LABELS): 
7824                       
7825                          if self._editTimer: 
7826                           
7827                              if self._editTimer.IsRunning(): 
7828                                   
7829                                  self._editTimer.Stop() 
7830                           
7831                          else: 
7832                           
7833                              self._editTimer = TreeEditTimer(self) 
7834                           
7835                          self._editTimer.Start(_DELAY, True) 
7836                       
7837                      self._lastOnSame = False 
7838                   
7839               
7840              else: # !RightDown() && !LeftUp() ==> LeftDown() || LeftDClick() 
7841   
7842                  if not item or not item.IsEnabled(): 
7843                      if self._editCtrl != None and item != self._editCtrl.item(): 
7844                          self._editCtrl.StopEditing() 
7845                      return 
7846   
7847                  if self._editCtrl != None and item != self._editCtrl.item(): 
7848                      self._editCtrl.StopEditing() 
7849   
7850                  self._hasFocus = True 
7851                  self.SetFocusIgnoringChildren() 
7852                   
7853                  if event.LeftDown(): 
7854                   
7855                      self._lastOnSame = item == self._current 
7856                       
7857                  if flags & TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMBUTTON: 
7858                   
7859                      # only toggle the item for a single click, double click on 
7860                      # the button doesn't do anything (it toggles the item twice) 
7861                      if event.LeftDown(): 
7862                       
7863                          self.Toggle(item) 
7864                       
7865                      # don't select the item if the button was clicked 
7866                      return 
7867   
7868                  if item.GetType() > 0 and (flags & TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMCHECKICON): 
7869   
7870                      if event.LeftDown(): 
7871                          if flags & TREE_HITTEST_ONITEM and self.HasAGWFlag(TR_FULL_ROW_HIGHLIGHT): 
7872                              self.DoSelectItem(item, not self.HasAGWFlag(TR_MULTIPLE)) 
7873   
7874                          if self.IsItem3State(item): 
7875                              checked = self.GetItem3StateValue(item) 
7876                              checked = (checked+1)%3 
7877                          else: 
7878                              checked = not self.IsItemChecked(item) 
7879                               
7880                          self.CheckItem(item, checked) 
7881                           
7882                      return                                             
7883   
7884                  # clear the previously selected items, if the 
7885                  # user clicked outside of the present selection. 
7886                  # otherwise, perform the deselection on mouse-up. 
7887                  # this allows multiple drag and drop to work. 
7888                  # but if Cmd is down, toggle selection of the clicked item 
7889                  if not self.IsSelected(item) or event.CmdDown(): 
7890   
7891                      if flags & TREE_HITTEST_ONITEM: 
7892                          # how should the selection work for this event? 
7893                          if item.IsHyperText(): 
7894                              self.SetItemVisited(item, True) 
7895                           
7896                          is_multiple, extended_select, unselect_others = EventFlagsToSelType(self.GetAGWWindowStyleFlag(), 
7897                                                                                              event.ShiftDown(), 
7898                                                                                              event.CmdDown()) 
7899   
7900                          self.DoSelectItem(item, unselect_others, extended_select) 
7901   
7902                  # Handle hyperlink items... which are a bit odd sometimes 
7903                  elif self.IsSelected(item) and item.IsHyperText(): 
7904                      self.HandleHyperLink(item) 
7905                       
7906                  # For some reason, Windows isn't recognizing a left double-click, 
7907                  # so we need to simulate it here.  Allow 200 milliseconds for now. 
7908                  if event.LeftDClick(): 
7909                   
7910                      # double clicking should not start editing the item label 
7911                      if self._editTimer: 
7912                          self._editTimer.Stop() 
7913   
7914                      self._lastOnSame = False 
7915   
7916                      # send activate event first 
7917                      nevent = TreeEvent(wxEVT_TREE_ITEM_ACTIVATED, self.GetId()) 
7918                      nevent._item = item 
7919                      nevent._pointDrag = self.CalcScrolledPosition(pt) 
7920                      nevent.SetEventObject(self) 
7921                      if not self.GetEventHandler().ProcessEvent(nevent): 
7922                       
7923                          # if the user code didn't process the activate event, 
7924                          # handle it ourselves by toggling the item when it is 
7925                          # double clicked 
7926  ##                        if item.HasPlus(): 
7927                          self.Toggle(item) 

7928                           
7929   

7930 -    def OnInternalIdle(self): 

7931          """ 
7932          This method is normally only used internally, but sometimes an application 
7933          may need it to implement functionality that should not be disabled by an 
7934          application defining an `OnIdle` handler in a derived class. 
7935   
7936          This method may be used to do delayed painting, for example, and most 
7937          implementations call `wx.Window.UpdateWindowUI` in order to send update events 
7938          to the window in idle time. 
7939          """ 
7940   
7941          # Check if we need to select the root item 
7942          # because nothing else has been selected. 
7943          # Delaying it means that we can invoke event handlers 
7944          # as required, when a first item is selected. 
7945          if not self.HasAGWFlag(TR_MULTIPLE) and not self.GetSelection(): 
7946           
7947              if self._select_me: 
7948                  self.SelectItem(self._select_me) 
7949              elif self.GetRootItem(): 
7950                  self.SelectItem(self.GetRootItem()) 
7951           
7952          # after all changes have been done to the tree control, 
7953          # we actually redraw the tree when everything is over 
7954   
7955          if not self._dirty: 
7956              return 
7957          if self._freezeCount: 
7958              return 
7959   
7960          self._dirty = False 
7961   
7962          self.CalculatePositions() 
7963          self.Refresh() 
7964          self.AdjustMyScrollbars() 

7965   
7966  #        event.Skip()         
7967   
7968   

7969 -    def CalculateSize(self, item, dc, level=-1, align=0): 

7970          """ 
7971          Calculates overall position and size of an item. 
7972   
7973          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
7974          :param `dc`: an instance of `wx.DC`; 
7975          :param integer `level`: the item level in the tree hierarchy; 
7976          :param integer `align`: an integer specifying the alignment type: 
7977   
7978           =============== ========================================= 
7979           `align` Value   Description 
7980           =============== ========================================= 
7981                  0        No horizontal alignment of windows (in items with windows). 
7982                  1        Windows (in items with windows) are aligned at the same horizontal position. 
7983                  2        Windows (in items with windows) are aligned at the rightmost edge of L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
7984           =============== ========================================= 
7985   
7986          """ 
7987   
7988          attr = item.GetAttributes() 
7989   
7990          if attr and attr.HasFont(): 
7991              dc.SetFont(attr.GetFont()) 
7992          else: 
7993              if item.IsBold(): 
7994                  dc.SetFont(self._boldFont) 
7995              elif item.IsItalic(): 
7996                  dc.SetFont(self._italicFont) 
7997              else: 
7998                  dc.SetFont(self._normalFont) 
7999   
8000          text_w, text_h, dummy = dc.GetMultiLineTextExtent(item.GetText()) 
8001          text_h+=2 
8002   
8003          # restore normal font 
8004          dc.SetFont(self._normalFont) 
8005   
8006          image_w, image_h = 0, 0 
8007          image = item.GetCurrentImage() 
8008   
8009          if image != _NO_IMAGE: 
8010           
8011              if self._imageListNormal: 
8012               
8013                  image_w, image_h = self._imageListNormal.GetSize(image) 
8014                  image_w += 4 
8015   
8016          total_h = ((image_h > text_h) and [image_h] or [text_h])[0] 
8017   
8018          checkimage = item.GetCurrentCheckedImage() 
8019          if checkimage is not None: 
8020              wcheck, hcheck = self._imageListCheck.GetSize(checkimage) 
8021              wcheck += 4 
8022          else: 
8023              wcheck = 0            
8024   
8025          if total_h < 30: 
8026              total_h += 2            # at least 2 pixels 
8027          else: 
8028              total_h += total_h/10   # otherwise 10% extra spacing 
8029   
8030          if total_h > self._lineHeight: 
8031              self._lineHeight = total_h 
8032   
8033          wnd = item.GetWindow() 
8034          if not wnd: 
8035              totalWidth = image_w+text_w+wcheck+2 
8036              totalHeight = total_h 
8037          else: 
8038              totalWidth = item.GetWindowSize()[0]+image_w+text_w+wcheck+2 
8039              totalHeight = max(total_h, item.GetWindowSize()[1]) 
8040   
8041          if level >= 0 and wnd: 
8042              if align == 0: 
8043                  if level in self.absoluteWindows: 
8044                      self.absoluteWindows[level] = max(self.absoluteWindows[level], image_w+text_w+wcheck+2) 
8045                  else: 
8046                      self.absoluteWindows[level] = image_w+text_w+wcheck+2 
8047              elif align == 1: 
8048                  self.absoluteWindows[level] = max(self.absoluteWindows[level], image_w+text_w+wcheck+2) 
8049   
8050          if item.IsSeparator(): 
8051              totalWidth = self.GetClientSize()[0] 
8052              totalHeight = total_h 
8053               
8054          item.SetWidth(totalWidth) 
8055          item.SetHeight(totalHeight) 

8056   
8057   

8058 -    def CalculateLevel(self, item, dc, level, y, align=0): 

8059          """ 
8060          Calculates the level of an item inside the tree hierarchy. 
8061   
8062          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
8063          :param `dc`: an instance of `wx.DC`; 
8064          :param integer `level`: the item level in the tree hierarchy; 
8065          :param integer `y`: the current vertical position inside the `wx.PyScrolledWindow`; 
8066          :param integer `align`: an integer specifying the alignment type: 
8067   
8068           =============== ========================================= 
8069           `align` Value   Description 
8070           =============== ========================================= 
8071                  0        No horizontal alignment of windows (in items with windows). 
8072                  1        Windows (in items with windows) are aligned at the same horizontal position. 
8073                  2        Windows (in items with windows) are aligned at the rightmost edge of L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
8074           =============== ========================================= 
8075   
8076          :return: The new `y` vertical position inside the `wx.PyScrolledWindow`. 
8077          """ 
8078   
8079          x = level*self._indent 
8080           
8081          if not self.HasAGWFlag(TR_HIDE_ROOT): 
8082           
8083              x += self._indent 
8084           
8085          elif level == 0: 
8086           
8087              # a hidden root is not evaluated, but its 
8088              # children are always calculated 
8089              children = item.GetChildren() 
8090              count = len(children) 
8091              level = level + 1 
8092              for n in xrange(count): 
8093                  y = self.CalculateLevel(children[n], dc, level, y, align)  # recurse 
8094                   
8095              return y 
8096           
8097          self.CalculateSize(item, dc, level, align) 
8098   
8099          # set its position 
8100          item.SetX(x+self._spacing) 
8101          item.SetY(y) 
8102          y += self.GetLineHeight(item) 
8103   
8104          if not item.IsExpanded(): 
8105              # we don't need to calculate collapsed branches 
8106              return y 
8107   
8108          children = item.GetChildren() 
8109          count = len(children) 
8110          level = level + 1 
8111          for n in xrange(count): 
8112              y = self.CalculateLevel(children[n], dc, level, y, align)  # recurse 
8113           
8114          return y 

8115       
8116   

8117 -    def CalculatePositions(self): 

8118          """ Calculates all the positions of the visible items. """ 
8119   
8120          if not self._anchor: 
8121              return 
8122   
8123          self.absoluteWindows = {} 
8124           
8125          dc = wx.ClientDC(self) 
8126          self.PrepareDC(dc) 
8127   
8128          dc.SetFont(self._normalFont) 
8129          dc.SetPen(self._dottedPen) 
8130          y = 2 
8131          y = self.CalculateLevel(self._anchor, dc, 0, y) # start recursion 
8132           
8133          if self.HasAGWFlag(TR_ALIGN_WINDOWS) or self.HasAGWFlag(TR_ALIGN_WINDOWS_RIGHT): 
8134              align = (self.HasAGWFlag(TR_ALIGN_WINDOWS) and [1] or [2])[0] 
8135              y = 2 
8136              y = self.CalculateLevel(self._anchor, dc, 0, y, align) # start recursion 

8137   
8138   

8139 -    def RefreshSubtree(self, item): 

8140          """ 
8141          Refreshes a damaged subtree of an item. 
8142           
8143          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
8144          """ 
8145   
8146          if self._dirty: 
8147              return 
8148          if self._freezeCount: 
8149              return 
8150   
8151          client = self.GetClientSize() 
8152   
8153          rect = wx.Rect() 
8154          x, rect.y = self.CalcScrolledPosition(0, item.GetY()) 
8155          rect.width = client.x 
8156          rect.height = client.y 
8157   
8158          self.Refresh(True, rect) 
8159          self.AdjustMyScrollbars() 

8160

8162 -    def RefreshLine(self, item):

8164          Refreshes a damaged item line.

8167          """

8170              return 
8171          if self._freezeCount: 
8172              return 
8173   
8174          rect = wx.Rect() 
8175          x, rect.y = self.CalcScrolledPosition(0, item.GetY()) 
8176          rect.width = self.GetClientSize().x 
8177          rect.height = self.GetLineHeight(item) 
8178   
8179          self.Refresh(True, rect)

8186              return

8189          #       selected items internally, should be much faster 
8190          if self._anchor: 
8191              self.RefreshSelectedUnder(self._anchor)

8194 -    def RefreshSelectedUnder(self, item): 

8195          """ 
8196          Refreshes the selected items under the given item. 
8197   
8198          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. 
8199          """ 
8200   
8201          if self._freezeCount: 
8202              return 
8203   
8204          if item.IsSelected(): 
8205              self.RefreshLine(item) 
8206   
8207          children = item.GetChildren() 
8208          for child in children: 
8209              self.RefreshSelectedUnder(child)

8212 -    def RefreshItemWithWindows(self, item=None): 

8213          """ 
8214          Refreshes the items with which a window is associated. 
8215   
8216          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}. If `item` is ``None``, then the 
8217           recursive refresh starts from the root node. 
8218            
8219          :note: This method is called only if the style ``TR_ALIGN_WINDOWS_RIGHT`` is used. 
8220          """ 
8221   
8222          if self._freezeCount: 
8223              return 
8224   
8225          if item is None: 
8226              if self._anchor: 
8227                  self.RefreshItemWithWindows(self._anchor) 
8228                  return 
8229   
8230          wnd = item.GetWindow()             
8231          if wnd and wnd.IsShown(): 
8232              self.RefreshLine(item) 
8233   
8234          children = item.GetChildren() 
8235          for child in children: 
8236              self.RefreshItemWithWindows(child) 

8237   
8238   

8239 -    def Freeze(self): 

8240          """ 
8241          Freeze L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
8242   
8243          Freezes the window or, in other words, prevents any updates from taking place 
8244          on screen, the window is not redrawn at all. L{Thaw} must be called to reenable 
8245          window redrawing. Calls to these two functions may be nested. 
8246   
8247          :note: This method is useful for visual appearance optimization (for example, 
8248           it is a good idea to use it before doing many large text insertions in a row 
8249           into a `wx.TextCtrl` under wxGTK) but is not implemented on all platforms nor 
8250           for all controls so it is mostly just a hint to wxWidgets and not a mandatory 
8251           directive. 
8252          """ 
8253   
8254          self._freezeCount = self._freezeCount + 1 

8255   
8256   

8257 -    def Thaw(self): 

8258          """ 
8259          Thaw L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
8260   
8261          Reenables window updating after a previous call to L{Freeze}. To really thaw the 
8262          control, it must be called exactly the same number of times as L{Freeze}. 
8263   
8264          :raise: `Exception` if L{Thaw} has been called without an un-matching L{Freeze}.         
8265          """ 
8266   
8267          if self._freezeCount == 0: 
8268              raise Exception("\nERROR: Thawing Unfrozen Tree Control?") 
8269   
8270          self._freezeCount = self._freezeCount - 1 
8271           
8272          if not self._freezeCount: 
8273              self.Refresh() 

8274       
8275   
8276      # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
8277      # changing colours: we need to refresh the tree control 
8278      # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
8279   

8280 -    def SetBackgroundColour(self, colour): 

8281          """ 
8282          Changes the background colour of L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
8283   
8284          :param `colour`: the colour to be used as the background colour, pass 
8285           `wx.NullColour` to reset to the default colour. 
8286   
8287          :return: ``False`` if the underlying `wx.PyScrolledWindow` does not accept 
8288           the new colour, ``True`` otherwise. 
8289            
8290          :note: The background colour is usually painted by the default `wx.EraseEvent` 
8291           event handler function under Windows and automatically under GTK. 
8292   
8293          :note: Setting the background colour does not cause an immediate refresh, so 
8294           you may wish to call `wx.Window.ClearBackground` or `wx.Window.Refresh` after 
8295           calling this function. 
8296   
8297          :note: Overridden from `wx.PyScrolledWindow`.          
8298          """ 
8299   
8300          if not wx.PyScrolledWindow.SetBackgroundColour(self, colour): 
8301              return False 
8302   
8303          if self._freezeCount: 
8304              return True 
8305   
8306          self.Refresh() 
8307   
8308          return True 

8309   
8310   

8311 -    def SetForegroundColour(self, colour): 

8312          """ 
8313          Changes the foreground colour of L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
8314   
8315          :param `colour`: the colour to be used as the foreground colour, pass 
8316           `wx.NullColour` to reset to the default colour. 
8317   
8318          :return: ``False`` if the underlying `wx.PyScrolledWindow` does not accept 
8319           the new colour, ``True`` otherwise. 
8320   
8321          :note: Overridden from `wx.PyScrolledWindow`.          
8322          """ 
8323   
8324          if not wx.PyScrolledWindow.SetForegroundColour(self, colour): 
8325              return False 
8326   
8327          if self._freezeCount: 
8328              return True 
8329   
8330          self.Refresh() 
8331   
8332          return True

8346 -    def DoGetBestSize(self): 

8347          """ 
8348          Gets the size which best suits the window: for a control, it would be the 
8349          minimal size which doesn't truncate the control, for a panel - the same size 
8350          as it would have after a call to `Fit()`. 
8351   
8352          :return: An instance of `wx.Size`. 
8353           
8354          :note: Overridden from `wx.PyScrolledWindow`. 
8355          """ 
8356                   
8357          # something is better than nothing... 
8358          # 100x80 is what the MSW version will get from the default 
8359          # wxControl::DoGetBestSize 
8360   
8361          return wx.Size(100, 80) 

8362   
8363           

8364 -    def GetMaxWidth(self, respect_expansion_state=True): 

8365          """ 
8366          Returns the maximum width of the L{CustomTreeCtrl}. 
8367           
8368          :param bool `respect_expansion_state`: if ``True``, only the expanded items (and their 
8369           children) will be measured. Otherwise all the items are expanded and 
8370           their width measured. 
8371   
8372          :return: the maximum width of L{CustomTreeCtrl}, in pixels.          
8373          """ 
8374   
8375          self.Freeze() 
8376           
8377          root = self.GetRootItem() 
8378          rect = self.GetBoundingRect(root, True) 
8379   
8380          # It looks like the space between the "+" and the node 
8381          # rect occupies 4 pixels approximatively 
8382          maxwidth = rect.x + rect.width + 4 
8383          lastheight = rect.y + rect.height 
8384           
8385          if not self.IsExpanded(root): 
8386              if respect_expansion_state: 
8387                  return maxwidth 
8388   
8389          if not respect_expansion_state: 
8390              self.ExpandAll() 
8391   
8392          maxwidth, lastheight = self.RecurseOnChildren(root, maxwidth, respect_expansion_state) 
8393   
8394          self.Thaw() 
8395           
8396          return maxwidth 

8397       
8398   

8399 -    def RecurseOnChildren(self, item, maxwidth, respect_expansion_state): 

8400          """ 
8401          Recurses over all the children of the spcified items, calculating their 
8402          maximum width. 
8403   
8404          :param `item`: an instance of L{GenericTreeItem}; 
8405          :param integer `maxwidth`: the current maximum width for L{CustomTreeCtrl}, in pixels; 
8406          :param bool `respect_expansion_state`: if ``True``, only the expanded items (and their 
8407           children) will be measured. Otherwise all the items are expanded and 
8408           their width measured. 
8409   
8410          :return: A tuple containing the maximum width and item height, in pixels.          
8411          """ 
8412           
8413          child, cookie = self.GetFirstChild(item) 
8414          lastheight = 0 
8415   
8416          while child: 
8417   
8418              rect = self.GetBoundingRect(child, True) 
8419               
8420              # It looks like the space between the "+" and the node 
8421              # rect occupies 4 pixels approximatively 
8422              maxwidth = max(maxwidth, rect.x + rect.width + 4) 
8423              lastheight = rect.y + rect.height 
8424               
8425              if self.IsExpanded(child) or not respect_expansion_state: 
8426                  maxwidth, lastheight = self.RecurseOnChildren(child, maxwidth, respect_expansion_state) 
8427               
8428              child, cookie = self.GetNextChild(item, cookie) 
8429   
8430          return maxwidth, lastheight 

8431   
8432       

8433 -    def GetClassDefaultAttributes(self): 

8434          """ 
8435          Returns the default font and colours which are used by the control. This is 
8436          useful if you want to use the same font or colour in your own control as in 
8437          a standard control -- which is a much better idea than hard coding specific 
8438          colours or fonts which might look completely out of place on the users system, 
8439          especially if it uses themes. 
8440   
8441          This static method is "overridden'' in many derived classes and so calling, 
8442          for example, `wx.Button.GetClassDefaultAttributes()` will typically return the 
8443          values appropriate for a button which will be normally different from those 
8444          returned by, say, `wx.ListCtrl.GetClassDefaultAttributes()`. 
8445   
8446          :return: An instance of `wx.VisualAttributes`. 
8447           
8448          :note: The `wx.VisualAttributes` structure has at least the fields `font`, 
8449           `colFg` and `colBg`. All of them may be invalid if it was not possible to 
8450           determine the default control appearance or, especially for the background 
8451           colour, if the field doesn't make sense as is the case for `colBg` for the 
8452           controls with themed background. 
8453   
8454          :note: Overridden from `wx.PyControl`.          
8455          """ 
8456   
8457          attr = wx.VisualAttributes() 
8458          attr.colFg = wx.SystemSettings_GetColour(wx.SYS_COLOUR_WINDOWTEXT) 
8459          attr.colBg = wx.SystemSettings_GetColour(wx.SYS_COLOUR_LISTBOX) 
8460          attr.font  = wx.SystemSettings_GetFont(wx.SYS_DEFAULT_GUI_FONT) 
8461          return attr 

8462   
8463      GetClassDefaultAttributes = classmethod(GetClassDefaultAttributes) 

8464
